qQu5gSoRTEhe7o4A1nk-Lg.text: I actually went here over a month ago but felt it worthy of saving for my 200th review.  If it wasn't for Yelp I this is one of the places I have eaten I never would have known about.  And it is sort of fun to tell your date your are going to eat in a mostly vacated strip mall just off the highway. :-)  I had been here previously for a Yelp event.  We arrived around 6 on a Saturday just as it was getting dark.  We got seated right away.  Even at that early hour the place was far from empty.  It seldom happens we are amongst the youngest folks in any venue so we happily take note.  As the evening went on the crowd got younger and the place was almost packed.  We got our waters and menus right away and then we sort of got forgotten for about 5 minutes or so before our waiter introduced himself and took our drink orders.  That would prove to be the only glitch in food or service the entire meal.  I had the PCG pasta and she had a black and blue burger.  I also had a salad with Blue cheese dressing.  Lately we seem to have been on a run of less than stellar blue cheese, both my dressing and the crumbles on her burger were good.  We both enjoyed our meal.  Usually we try some of each others food but I declined to take a bite of a well done burger, however she thought it was great.  I did sample the fries and they were pretty good.  The beer selection had a couple of selections I liked to choose from.  Excellent place for a nice dinner out.  Even if you get in to steaks the place is not over the top expensive.  It was quiet enough we no trouble talking.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PCG pasta
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black and Blue burger

iUmXg42-qgWPSsNNGIOEsw.text: The appetizers were very good. I enjoyed the much raved about "Griddled Corn Cakes" The queso was also unique and delicious.  The butter lettuce wedge salad was so delicious. They even chopped it for me to make it easier to eat.  The pork tenderloin was so tender and moist. I"m not a huge fan of this dish in general, but they made me a fan.  They keep things interesting by having specials daily.  The servers seemed very novice. They did not remember drink orders, I found it unusual they would walk away then come right back and ask again what we said.  Went on a Monday Night at 730pm. It was definitely still active at that time. I imagine weekends must be crazy.  The food and atmosphere was excellent, I was a little disappointed in the service. Otherwise would have given 4 stars.

Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GbxSyXTcBwa_LBIqfWnanw.text: Excellent food and service.  Salmon was so tender and moist and the sauce wonderfully complementary for the fish.  Portions were perfect. Vegetables were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fsEk3NyrRgRu43fjuPCVVA.text: A romantic old-town tavern ambiance in the heart of Uptown Phoenix, providing a high quality, very gracious dining experience. This house is a delicious hangout that has become a haven for those looking to escape a typical, nightly scene.  For happy hour this evening and at half price off the regular menu, I ordered the grilled skewers. Two chicken, two beef drizzled in peanut sauce and jalapeno preserves $8. Machaca beef stuffed green chili, Menonita cheese, Diegos red chili sauce, salsa fresca, pickeled red onions on a warm small tortilla. $6. Signature bacon wrapped shrimp stuffed with cotija cheese and served with chipotle lime aioli lime $6.  From the bar, Markwest Pinot Nior $8. A fruity and easy-drinking full body wine and a Four Peaks Sun brew $5.  Quiet neighborhood and lovely people.  Casa Bonita.

XDSe7qKBL40PXE1AZd2Mpw.text: I came here for dinner last night with my mom and grandma and wow was that a good idea! We had amazing service from our server Asher! He made our experience at PCG unforgettable. Very knowledgable of the menu, quick getting our food out, and very friendly. If you go to PCG ask if Asher is working because he is the absolute best!! Thank you for a great dinner, I will definitely be coming back soon!

HWXsihO6J7091w2C8D_5Xw.text: I feel bad reviewing this one low but on my visit for lunch today our entrees were less than review worthy.    I had the lunch special salad... A pile (big on the quantity) of BBQ short rib meat (shredded) over lettuce and some sad salsa.    It was not very tasty. My guests had a salad and a special burger.  I've never seen this guy dismiss a good looking entree until today.  His  face on first bite said it all.  I thought it was undercooked---no, he said it was just strange.  He only ate half. The highlight of his plate was the cup if green chili which was also a special.    Atmosphere was good Waitstaff was friendly Parking a little limited Outside seating and nice inside bar Selection of wine and specials  Large menu includes some texmex looking items, American and some pasta.  Several salads, interesting salads  Gluten free options Veggie plate is an entree I wish I would have tried.

bENHjbY7Ljh2ZTEiw8R-yg.text: Locally owned, place with great bred, however their chef could have planned better They were out of both the first main dish and side I ordered for lunch.  Due to this I ended up with a "crispy egg plant sandwich" with a side salad as my side." $11  Given the size and lack of inspiration with this dish I feel that the value was not there, this lac of solid value seemed consistent across the board.   The taste was decent nothing amazing or terrible.  I am in no rush to go back.

D12ElbNKaPyRNxq68U5Aug.text: This place is as good as every review I have heard since moving to the neighborhood.  Crispy Eggplant Bites with citrus-red pepper relish| goat cheese | arugula| tomato jam | red wine vinaigrette | balsamic reduction = YUMMMMY!  The Original Griddled Corn Cakes with black beans | grilled chicken | jack cheese | salsa fresca = HEAVEN!  We'll return again and again.

KUSF3a4H2SXjrPYWqHqHnA.text: Our party of seven had no complaints! Just great service and great food! My wife and I both had the Bethany Home Salad, excellent choice! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Birthday Tweets!

oG7950DRxk88JKjVbZ_8dg.text: Walking into PCG on a recent Sunday for brunch, I wasn't sure what to expect.  The place was pretty much empty.  Coming off a few less than stellar recent brunch attempts at other local spots (why is it so hard to find good Eggs Benedict!?), I took this to be a less than favorable sign about the meal ahead...    Well, I was wrong...  PCG served some of my favorite things!  A mimosa with fresh-squeezed OJ started things off nicely.   :)   On to an appetizer - yes, even brunch deserves an appetizer!  I was happy to see Jumbo Bacon-Wrapped Shrimp on the menu.  Now that Wildfish no longer serves them, I have been hunting for a new favorite.  These were delicious - 4 large shrimp, stuffed with cojita cheese and wrapped in bacon - perfect with the accompanying chipotle-lime aioli.  And last, the main event.  The Tenderloin Eggs Benedict was fantastic.  Two English muffins graced with generous slices of medium-rare tenderloin, poached (not overdone - hooray!) eggs and tangy hollandaise.  This masterpiece came with diced breakfast potatoes (not greasy at all!) and a small bowl of fresh fruit.  Yum!    Thank you, PCG, for renewing my faith in brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon wrapped shrimp, stuffed with cojita cheese

0Y5eJQiz4EHwMlBObYEySw.text: My wife and I ate lunch there yesterday on the patio.  The inside is very nice and a very large bar area.  Service was good.  I ordered the beef short ribs which was very good.  The part that really put me off was the mashed potatoes.  There is only ONE option and that is Horseradish mashed potatoes.  I was hesitant because I just don't do horseradish in anything.  It was not horrible but come on, Horseradish mashed potatoes?  Garlic or plain, Yes.  I'm surprised there is not at least one other option for mashed potatoes.  Unfortunately, that is enough to keep me from coming back because I love mashed potatoes but not Horseradish!!!

U9lel16lZDKAy_7ABLuhXw.text: We had lunch today at Phoenix City Grill which is just about 2.5 miles north our home and were pleasantly surprised. We'd heard good things about it but never tried it. We arrived about 12:30 and were seated immediately. Judging by the parking lot I was prepared for a wait. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We ordered drinks and the hummus plate to start. All good. I had the 16th St. Burger with a side of Sweet Potato Fries. I ordered my burger cooked to medium and that's exactly how it arrived. A nice surprise. My companion ordered the Phoenix Cheese Steak Sandwich which he loved. For a side he ordered the Horseradish Mashed Potatoes. I got a taste and they were awesome. We didn't have room for dessert. I'd highly recommend PCG. We'll definitely be back.

pdGiLVKRhoo-H4PxyfOohA.text: Excellent service.  I ordered a tenderloin.  It was delicious and cooked just exactly  the way I requested.

7Rrzqx8lXhrYfoVQhJMrzA.text: I've lived down the street from PCG since December 2015 - finally got around to visiting.  AWESOME!  Really great atmosphere - much larger on the inside than you would expect from looking at the outside.  Rebekka was our server and she was fantastic.  I ordered a side salad (not listed on the menu but they were happy to prepare) and asked for a dinner roll.  The roll was crusty on the outside, soft on the inside and served hot with butter on the side - the roll was delicious!  In fact - so good that I ended up asking for and eating two more :)  I selected the Smoked Pork Shoulder ($22.00) and my dinner companion selected the Bowl of Chili & Cornbread ($12.00).  For dessert, we shared an order of the Bread Pudding ($8.00).  All items had a great presentation and all were very, very delicious!  The portions were generous.  Looking forward to my next visit - it will be soon!

dXtbXmhZtZLKW6HKRBZADQ.text: Came here last night with a group of 5 of us last night for some dinner and cocktails, we didn't make a reservation but were able to grab a bar table without a wait.  This place is really nice inside; not what you would expect to find when you realize it's nestled inside of a strip mall.  Our server was actually the bartender and he was impressive, very quick and knowledgeable.  I had a late lunch so I wasn't looking for a large meal so I ordered the soup and salad combination.  The chicken tortilla soup here is to die for!  My friend loved it so much she actually ordered a second helping.  My boyfriend had the ribs and said they were amazing.    It's a bit out of the way for me, but I would certainly like to come back sometime and try out an entree.  Overall I would definitely recommend coming here!

LauEJccdWwoRTbJ1HRb6hg.text: Oh wow! We came here with a group of friends and one of them had chosen this restaurant. It's not close to where we live, but we are already looking forward to our next chance to eat here.  Our group was 10 people and our server was fantastic. She took our drink orders right away and had no complaints about splitting the check into 5 separate checks. I am usually the one who wants to make changes and substitutions and she said that they were no problem. And they weren't - my food came out just right. I had the short ribs and added cornbread instead of one of the sides. The cornbread was great - it was moist and just the right amount of sweet, and it was served still a bit warm. And the short ribs were wonderful with a rich wine sauce. My husband had the special of pork that was sliced and served on mashed cauliflower with some other sides. He could not say enough good things about his meal.

L2BEalni_LZ5pj8M96Lvmg.text: Everyone is super nice. I love this place. It's my first time here and I'm definitely coming back. They are fast friendly and attentive. I got the a Burger and fries they were delicious. I just can't believe I have never been here before. What have I been doing withy life.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar is awesome but the fries are to die for

gmpfzQr3_Pevzpy_O9PF4g.text: I'm probably not PCG's biggest fan but I bet I am close...this place is one of the best restaurants.  As always the food is fantastic, the service is stellar and the atmosphere is perfect to enjoy a meal.   Today Karla was our waitress and she was so friendly and helpful.  Part of the charm and atmosphere of Phoenix City Grill is everyone that works there.  Karla did a fantastic job.  She made the meal just that much better.  Thank you Karla!!!!  Cowboy steak was the choice this time, but really, that is the choice most every visit.  I have tried many of the other entrees and they are very good, but there is just something about the Cowboy Steak on a bed of chili...  Not the chili your mom made, just better!!!  If you want a steak this meal will definitely become one of your favorites.  I try to go to PCG every time I am in Phoenix.  If I lived there it would be more often.    This time they gave us the Chocolate Tort and well it was beyond what I would expect for a dessert.  The Tort was very light, but add the vanilla ice cream and strawberry puree..it was pretty fantastic.    I promise you if you go you will not be disappointed.  I can say I have never had a bad meal or lousy service in the dining room.

NxLiBIDiD-SymhdOQvLQhg.text: I've been here dozens of times and each time they're 5 stars.  The queso dip is the 2nd best in the city! I hear it's the same owners and Sierra Bonita...  The street tacos are amazing and along with the green and red salsa they're the best in the city.  The portion size is bigger than avg. The prices are spot on for what your get and definitely worth it. Not cheap, not expensive.  Service is always fast and friendly.  Not hipster, not trendy. Just awesome food and great service.

2wz5msHNVypIqj9duMNZ4g.text: What can I say about Phoenix City Grill.If you are looking for an adult restaurant, this is the place. The atmosphere and the service are always point on. Have never had a bad meal. Just a great place to relax, have a few drinks, get away from the kids and have a nice dinner. Try it you will be luv it.

TZLeZpWydgkl7dZp0W8eJQ.text: Nothing special.   The food, what little they give you, was decent. The chicken was very flavorful, the vegetables were ok.  Not worth what they charge for it.  The small portions, coupled with the  neo-country sound track make this a one time stop for me.

3rXo729JyuYktYee1Eoyxw.text: We don't live in Phoenix but are sure to visit every time we are in town over many years.  The food is beyond good and is consistent.  Our food is always the perfect temperature, the best ingredients and very nicely presented every time!  Last week we were in for lunch and decided upon the burger of the day.  It was wood grilled chuck with memonita cheese, tomatillo salsa, cornmeal crusted jalapenos, arugula and local tomatoes on a toasted talera roll.  I could not resist, what creativity in putting together the ingredients.  OMG it was the best burger I ever had and I eat more of them than I should!  It was very juicy, all the ingredients blended perfectly, not over kill, and all on a wonderful warm toasty roll.  This is why I keep coming back.  The wait-staff was friendly and attentive as usual.

w-FZh-z4JIY7RxwkSL_s9g.text: Phoenix City Grill is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The food is always amazing. There's always a special dish so I can try new things. The staff is excellent.   I love to take out of town guests here, but it's also our go-to spot for date night. I highly recommend PCG & their sister restaurant, Sierra Bonita.

xn6AOoPx3rZeFmVRRgt7kw.text: Highs: Consistently good specials, fair prices, brief but nice wine list, dim lighting, nice ambiance  Lows: Parking, spotty service   PCG is a neighborhood fave, with lots of locals who keep the place relatively busy. Reservations required for peak times. The staff is always friendly if occasionally slower that I like, which is probably a good thing if you are there on a date. And it is a great place for a date, with low lighting and upscale, cherry-wood decor.  The food, however, is what keeps the clientele coming back for more. The menu is a solid collection of steak and seafood standards, with some unique alterations to keep things interesting. Most have a southwestern flair. Cedar-plank salmon is a personal favorite. Pay close attention to the specials, though; uncommon combinations of ingredients often generate the same response, "Wow, that sounds great!"  Additional amenities include a very nice bar, with a couple of TVs, as well as a private dining room for large parties.

Joz4AXf1ptfj1DqgIRbYFg.text: What a place for brunch. $4 drinks are fantastic. Their tenderloin egg Benedict and sea food sandwich is heavenly. Wish we had such a place in Los Angeles.

lCkL24430vuj6JQSf0-TVQ.text: Since my review of TexAz, I thought it would be good to review PCG kiddycorner to TexAz.    Picture a Strip mall....you walk in....lights turned low, red walls, dark carpet...intimate...perfect...you've forgotten about the strip mall.    The restaurant was one of the first restaurants that I tried when I moved to AZ in 1998.  Thank you to my Aunt Marge for taking me to this little gem.  The food is what I like to call great american cuisine elevated.  PCG can, in my book call itself the most dependable dinner in the valley.  I have frequented this establishment many of times and have never had to complain about a single thing in the restaurant.....maybe when they closed for that short time back in 2000 I bitched a little.    When a restaurant puts Mac N' Cheese on a menu...they are dying to be critiqued hard...So I use Mac N' Cheese as a measure of quality.  Mac N' Cheese is such a bad name because Kraft and Velveeta have raped it of legitamacy in the culinary world.  Now PCG makes a darn creamy rich flavorful Mac N' Cheese and that to me signifies attention to quality.  I have had bad MNC at other "deconstructed" restaurants but PCG doesn't stray to far from the point of the dish...and they are successful.   I also fancy the Pot Roast or the Pork Tenderloin.  To start I seem to always get the black bean soup and always happy I did.  Great place!!  Will always be included as my diamond in the rough restaurant.

BRtE2BSmZzgCZe0f3rENtg.text: Went there last night to celebrate a good friend's birthday. Loved the dim lights atmosphere, which seem to made the couples celebrating Valentine's Day feel more comfortable.  The service was excellent. Jose our server did not fail to pay attention to each member of our 15+ party. Appetizers and entrees were enjoyed by everyone. The portions were good for all to share, and as the restaurant mentions on their website, the prices are reasonable. I had the almond crusted tilapia, with a raspberry butter sauce and green beens, and truly enjoyed it.  Will come back.

R974YGvMykctK9MKlmhwKw.text: We stopped in for lunch and had a great experience. The food is great and the service was good too. If you stop in, remember that there is parking in the back, it is pretty hard to park in the front.

7UocMtlyUTV9VNlR4Tfhvw.text: I really enjoy PCG, mostly because it IS a neighborhood restaurant.  It's predictable and simple.  It's reasonably priced and far better than standard.    Things I adore are: Griddled corn cakes with black beans and grilled chicken, so good and less than $10. The carnitas taco app is wonderful and SO much food.  It's too much for me to eat at dinner and it's about eight bucks! The pot roast sounds simple, and it is, but dang, it's so yummy.  Super tender meat and homemade mashed potatoes with just the right about of gravy and topped with fried parsnips.  You can't go wrong.  I'm very disappointed that two things I loved on the menu are gone.  First, is the ahi salad, it was really good.  When I inquired, I was told that with the rising costs of ahi that it wasn't a cost effective option.  I LOVED, LOVED, LOVED the blackened chicken sandwich.  I craved it.  Blackened chicken with applewood smoked bacon, jack cheese on a grilled bun.  They changed.  Dammit!  Why?  I'm holding a little grudge on that one.  At lunch, I always get the soup and salad.  Soups are good, particularly the yellow split pea and I love the honey ginger salad dressing.  The bar is good for happy hour and relaxing after a movie or a night out.

8Q9jBaN_Fnm7qH2dFodhPA.text: 12-24-10  We have been coming here for Christmas eve dinner for three years, my husband and in-laws.  We usually eat early, before church, but this year  made reservation at 8:30pm, after the service.  When we arrived, the place was packed.  Even with reservation it took an hour to get seated but we knew it was due to the holiday.  The manager comp'd us free appetizers due to the delay.  We ordered crab cake & skewers(chicken and beef) and they were good, with the hint of Thai accent.  For the entrees my husband order a pasta and seafood dish which he liked.  His brother had a delicious pork chop.  I ordered pasta and jumbo shrimp on the side but the server forgot to add the shrimp, which delayed things even further.  Phoenix City Grill is one of our favorites but this time they were too busy to provide prompt seating and service we expect.  We only visit once a year.  Maybe next time will be better.

qm6vYI7poAdqaP_RFzvWlw.text: Yummmmmmmmmmmmm  We went here on Mothers Day, and man am I glad we had reservations! Even with reservations we still had to wait at least 10 minutes to be seated, they were hoppin in there!   Once we were seated our wiatress was quick to take our drink order.   I ordered the griddled corn cakes and that has all I have thoguht about since taking my last bite. They were beyond amazing!   I have never been here for brunch before but think I will need to go back very soon! Such a great brunch to honor an awesome mother in law!

mAFs7_A8XEJcilxHnRioNw.text: After reading other folks reviews I thought I'd try Phoenix City Grill out with a group of friends. There were 5 of us, and they seated us right away for a Saturday night at 8pm.   Good location, a little dark while reading the menu. But we were happy with the options, nice for those who wanted a good steak or entree, or for those who want something on the cheaper side of the menu.   The waitress Kathryn was friendly and quick though she had a lot of tables. Water was prompt and drinks and wine served within a few minutes of order. We ordered the Goat Cheese toast points and it took a while to get to the table, but they were worth it. Really Yummy.   My friends ordered the Phoenix Cheese Steak and the Black and Bleu Burger. Both looked really good, and they received good feedback. I ordered the Rose something Chicken and it was really good with the tarragon au jus. The best though was the Pork Tenderloin, super yummy and totally worth the price. It was really flavorful with the jalapeno jelly they basted it with, and the meat had a really smoky flavor to the meat. The quinoa cakes were really tasty for quinoa. We decided to do dessert and the buttermilk pie was amazing. I'm from the South and this was the real deal. The Bread pudding was really good as was the Chocolate torte.   Overall very happy with this restaurant. We will definitely be coming back. Especially for Happy Hour, close to if not half price appetizers till 6 drink specials. Great bar and lounge atmosphere.

_n_r7rzHqJ32Aa5m2qCQiA.text: Do you know someone that you like, but you just hate to eat out with because they are either criticizing everything or making remarks about the prices the whole time?  Normally, I recommend dropping them off at Outback on the way to your dinner reservations, but I think I found a place to take them!  I haven't been here before because it is a bit out of my normal daily range, and its not in a place where you would find it unless you know where to go.  But I have heard about this place from downtown types who swear by it.  Stacy the Complainer and I had the bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer.  She had the griddle corn cakes, and I had the beef tenderloin.  The surroundings are very nice, but comfortable.  Service is attentive and friendly, if not always fast.  Plan to take your time, you can't rush a good experience.  The wine list was short, but good - not pretentious at all.  Anyway, not much of a peep out of STC, because she was busy with her plate for quite a while.  She still took a good bit home for later.  I'm almost always good for a steak, and the tenderloin was exceptional.  It is served with sauteed mushrooms and a twice-baked potato.  Good spud!  Would have been fine with a couple of those.  And there was really nothing for STC to say about the check, either (even though she has never been known to willingly pick one up).  Actually, I was surprised at the prices, given the atmosphere, which would suggest a pricier total.    Overall, I'd say its definitely worth a try, even if you aren't a downtown person - worth the trip!

sL08W6wjv68UBh5z2d9OEw.text: We parked in the back and came in through a section where you can see the kitchen. That was our first wow factor as not many places want you to see back there. It was clean! Busy Friday night so we sat at the bar. Service was fairly attentive. App came out super slow; bar staff was apologetic as they had a large party being served. Drinks were kept full throughout. We had the seabass($24) special and pork tenderloin($21). Absolutely phenomenal dishes. Ordered a side of fingerling potatoes ($5) and those were very dry/overcooked and came out so late. Our bar tender picked up the tab on those. Free dessert we had the torte ($8) and weren't disappointed. Total bill with one mixed drink was $68. Worth every penny. It seems dark and uppity at first but the music sounds like it's one of the kitchen staff's ipod, which we found amazing and definitely offset the first glance of high class diners.

-7T4FmY4Xi9rYFfBxCHgwA.text: We eat here at least once a month, always great quality.  Burgers, Pot Roast, Ribs (great now that they have the half rack option) and the filet are all great.  Service is always good, even when we had a party of 15.

wUbScF8YC2aPk83jLIX2mQ.text: This place has a great happy hour which we have been to a couple of times so we decided to have dinner there.  No comparison.  The burger I ordered was very dry and flavorless.  The bun was falling apart.  The "beef sliders" ordered by a member of our group were slices of dried out pot roast on a bun.  The shrimp appetizer ordered by another person was OK.  None of the food was outstanding (a $12.00 burger in central Phx should be).  Service was good.  The wine list was unusual and fairly priced.  I felt the prices were rather high for the quality of food.  The place was very dark which made it difficult to get around.  We shall stick with the happy hours there and skip the dinners.

v_8GxYnTtAfIipqx1H3Sxw.text: Hey Clark K. Don't you work for Richardsons?  Why would you go around bashing other restaurants?  PCG is awesome!!!  Their food is soooo yummy!  It is my favorite restaurant in Phx!  Every time I am in Phx.  I make it a point to go to PCG.  I love the staff, the shrimp wrapped in bacon and all the daily specials.  It's a great place to have a business lunch and the Happy Hour is the best!.  You can actually see your plate and the person your talking to.   So folks, you need to totally disregard what Clark K.  wrote.  He does NOT know what he is talking about.  I think he is angry because he doesn't have a job. The restaurant, Richardsons, he worked at burnt down.  PHOENIX CITY GRILL ROCKS!!!

tz3VgxVZiCt3EMnWZWvUxQ.text: I had a lunch meeting here yesterday and had to wait for my clients to arrive so I got to watch the active so to speak for a few minutes. I have got to say what a fab little place with great customer service!  The staff greeted the regulars by first name and were extremely welcoming everyone coming in the door.  The food was great, the wine list was extensive  and i was told by my client that they make the best drinks in town!  I was not expecting too much from the cob salad I had but is was fresh and they did not skimp on the toppings.  I can't wait to go again.

_GN2qYuQMm4UaR6KiTDecA.text: Phoenix City Grille is a great place for family and friends. Despite the draw back of being in a strip mall, the ambiance inside is very warm and welcoming. Instantly you will get the urge to enjoy a cocktail or in my case a Martini. PCG only gets better with the food. Classic comfort foods with a little southwest twist. The Griddle Corn Cakes were fantastic. You can definitely order that appetizer as an entree. I had the green chile burger and it was delicious. I don't think you could go wrong with any of the dishes on this menu. We will be back soon and often.

0gbTL4OMBwxxknDzVOPQ9Q.text: Had an outstanding dinner there in one of their private rooms with a group of 12.  Food was outstanding!  Service was excellent.  Private room was quiet and had their own private bathroom.  Reasonable pricing.  Try the bread pudding for dessert.... its the best in town.  I highly recommend PCG.

ZAMTD85Df0ypRfvK1HZ2nQ.text: Hidden gem! This place has great drinks, happy hour, and friendly staff. They were more than accommodating at a busy bar! Ive been here numerous times at various times of the day and always have a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hidden gem! This place has great drinks, happy hour, and friendly staff. They were more than accommodating at a busy bar!

MU19_3Bp95WtGgM8VTyuWg.text: This is the best restaurant in Phoenix! We eat there at least twice a week. They have a great happy hour too with a great selection of small dishes.

nyHWdu8qinRlEVwQnt_p0Q.text: Mediocre! Bethany Home Salad had no chicken, way too many tortilla strips, too much dressing and too many tomatoes. Not consistent with amounts. There was more tortilla strips than lettuce. Felt like I was eating dressing soaked tortilla strips and tomatoes. Server was MIA. Needed refill and never received it.

oei2jaoMniVoLbetMl-NMQ.text: Great place for happy hour! Everything on the menu is amazing. The black bean soup with the delicious cornbread is to die for. The entire staff is so welcoming and friendly. I will definitely be returning.

D4BNfpbVAxiMjN8Y8rQU4w.text: The best word to describe this restaurant may me: "reliable".  You can rely upon PCG for very good service, very reasonable pricing, and very interesting takes on basic food offerings.  Eg. their margarita is an outstanding riff on a basic drink.  According to my spouse, perhaps the best anywhere.  Absolutely worth a trip either for good Happy Hour specials or a straight forward dinner.

HvI8jWEIF6AowB_cRQ8sdw.text: Stopped in for a quiet drink and bite to eat. The staff are friendly and helpful. The menu options are robust. The happy hour menu offers items at a discount of a couple of bucks cheaper than the menu. They offer a nice  sounding weekend brunch that I will be trying in the future. Its great to see vegetarian options on the menu along side the meat courses.  Bon Appetit

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice trendy place for a quiet dinner. Robust menu with plenty of options for meat eaters and vegetarians.

Q_CaX4MOtJC2E4wr10gZEQ.text: We returned once again and the food was top notch. Burgers are delicious. They almost rival The Attic and that is saying a lot. I am still working on getting the bartender to laugh. It is now my quest to get him to smile. Drinks are generous pours and made with quality hooch.

RxwTo4kMBLDBd1lAvjE6Sw.text: Yesterday was our first visit and both my wife and I said "What took us so long to find this gem!" As is typical for us, we most often visit the bar on a first visit. We tend to get a great feel from a place through the bartender/server. This was no exception. Max was our server and he was outstanding! He was professional, attentive and pointed out the must haves on the menu. Wife and I are light eaters, but we want to make sure we get a good representation of the chops in the kitchen and Max was correct. We started off with the Eggplant bites. Fried eggplant with goat cheese, sweet pepper, Arugula, a tomato jam and a drizzle of balsamic. Yum! We then had the bacon wrapped shrimp. What can I add to this? We split the kale and Brussel sprout salad and added a salmon skewer. The salad was terrific, but the salmon added a nice touch. It was wonderfully marinated in herbs and lemon. For dessert, we had the coconut panna cotta. Light and creamy! The best part was the caramelized pineapple and 2 huge blackberries. The also have a terrific wine list and on this visit we chose the unoaked Chardonnay from Hess. Fantastic. We had such a great time and guarantee you will too. Cannot wait to come back.

s2SZ8mQAGbMdf1s25s3skQ.text: Attended a private party here with friends. It's amazing! You wouldn't expect it from the exterior since it's in a shopping center but the interior is nice and intimate and I adored the private seating and wait staff we had! I'd love to go here for dinner again!

HESDyy3qc1pYitNuVP6lOA.text: Good place for food, service and  ambience. I have gone there alone and with a group and everything has ways been a great experience.

gOTuLCbEvAOitKwiIyRK4A.text: Great local place, the food is a hit. We tried the brunch this past weekend and was pleasantly surprised, definitely on our brunch list now. Good place to come unwind and toss back a cocktail with some good food as well.

mUM9668bkwHC9buE5tMtQA.text: I wrote my first review in 2010, second in 2013, and my latest at the end of 2017.  My wife Sally and I think that this is the best and most consistent restaurant in the valley for both food and service. We dine at numerous other restaurants that we like, but we eat at Phoenix City Grille every week and are never disappointed.

2_6LYxsMD64cmnUNvYNGTQ.text: Awesome place to eat in Phoenix and the PCG Margarita was great!

HnYm8h4wko07meFiqLOJaQ.text: Had the beef rib with horseradish mashed potatoes and a couple of baby thin carrots. perfect!! Iced tea delicious. My friends bread roll I stole, best roll ever, shell a perfect hardness but not sourdough hard.   Friend had beet salad w shrimp. Skimpy on the amount of food on it. Shrimp were good though. She had the pudding thing dessert and it was pretty good. Kind of like a soggy French toast.   After we got our food, waiter didn't come back as frequently.   Second time here. Delicious. Will return again.

wfayVgpSIPefOvkKHrwHNA.text: I just hosted a graduation party/dinner at PCG and had a fabulous experience! Brittnee did a great job with the booking - answered the phone on the first ring and answered all my questions! Then I was greeted warmly and shown around by owner Nina when I came to look at the room. The event itself went very smoothly. Our server Sean took excellent care of our 12 guests, even going above and beyond by helping cut the huge, gorgeous cake Sassi Cakes made for our graduate and taking a lot of group photos. He was pleasant, attentive, but never intrusive. Food and drink quality was excellent, and the pacing was perfect. Absolutely NO complaints, will be sure to recommend Phoenix City Grille to friends and colleagues.

PMsGqLQCq8qmaL1J8ZQ5cg.text: Came here for lunch with my co-workers.  I ordered a salad that came with beets and pecans... I forget the name.  it was quite small for $10, but it tasted good.  I wanted a pasta, but did not see any dairy-free options on their menu.  What was annoying is that my food came out about 5 minutes later than everyone else's.... even though it was a SALAD that did not require any cooking.  what's up with that!?  The nice thing about this restaurant is we were able to get a private room for our party of about 9 people.

OxwAe-Xx9gL7V9FbXro6iA.text: This was our first time here and we are quite pleased. Ryan was a very accommodating server. He gave us perfect recommendations and we never felt pushed. Also, our meal and cocktails were delicious. Come here and get the bourbon beets, you will not be disappointed!

CK7aifxZcoFwjMqgBAuD4g.text: We enjoyed the service here and the food was amazing. We split a salmon skewer appetizer which was amazingly delicious. The wedge salad which was mediocre for a wedge salad but it was acceptable. And then we ordered a chicken special which was cooked to perfection with a crispy outside skin moist and delicious inside with serve with butternut squash and mushrooms it was fantastic.  Then we had a chocolate torte for dessert which was delicious served piping hot with vanilla ice cream. We loved this dining experience and would definitely leave here again.

f9Qo-PlI3Z_lDj5BI9Ea6Q.text: The happy hour hummus, soy glazed chicken skewers and the green chile enchiladas were nice and light and hit the spot! Cool local spot that is worthwhile checking out the eclectic menu!

zPVOofAXE7O-fRHQZDleTg.text: Just Love this place! One of my favorite places to eat. The ambience is perfect.  The PCG pasta is my favorite pasta dish around. Have had a few different short rib dishes there and was never disappointed.

geKlDRvqSI7NO_F8jjcppQ.text: I found this restaurant in Yelp.  I have to say it lives up to my high demanding standard.  First of all, the atmosphere is just right if you are looking for a decent place to go for a dinner gathering.  I have ordered the "Arizona Cowboy Steak", it is not cheap but I guarantee you will find every penny worth.  I have it cooked in medium rare.  The meat is so tender and juicy.  You can taste the freshness.  I finishing my dinner with "Bailey Cheesecake" as the dessert.  This is the highlight of the dinner, the cake is so great, not to sweet and you can taste the favor of bailey.  I am looking forward to visit the restaurant again..... always support good restaurant with heart in making great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A great Arizona Cowboy Steak

POpEF-qEoJ3__iNcKkiqqA.text: Great place to go for after-work drinks. Varied happy hour menu. Very peaceful and quiet. Nice ambience. Waiter wasn't too attentive at first, but he eventually came around. The Grilled Salmon and Lemon Skewer and glass of Riesling was divine after a long day!

pkseFa3KtF72vuHRlNuI-w.text: Came here for a friend's birthday,  staff was very attentive and food was excellent! I ordered the cowboy steak over beans and it was cooked perfectly.  I think we had 8 people in our party and every one of us was ranting and raving about the flavor and freshness of our dishes. My boyfriend ordered the salmon with fingerling potatoes,  delicious.  Looking forward to our next meal here....great place!

pi8WAwssomAFtrJEYMHTbA.text: Ate here recently while on vacation in Phoenix.  The food was great, as was the service.    Everything we had was delicious.  We sampled the eggplant bites, hummus and the grilled skewers (beef and chicken) off the appetizer menu and they were delicious.  The blue cheese lettuce wedge (made with bib rather than iceberg lettuce)  was as good as any I've had.  Both the black and bleu burger and the traditional cheese burgers looked great, and were raved about as well.    To finish we sampled the seasonal cheesecake and the crossaint bread pudding.  Don't leave without trying one of these decadent treats!    I'll be back for more the next time I'm in Phoenix!

YvHN81jP6D4ZCOvwQoQ4-g.text: A really nice place, attentive service, and no complaints after five visits.  I agree with Steve V. that the eggplant appetizer is *really, really* good!  Also love the beet salad and the ribs.  Fish of the day has always been good, too.

eSitJola_oH17CELIjY2-g.text: PCG is a really good, reliable place to grab some good food and drinks. Sometimes the service is amazing, sometimes it's pretty good, but it is always a safe bet.  I recommend the cheeseburgers and margaritas. They are very tasty and pair nicely. The atmosphere is very comfortable, dark and cozy. This is a local spot, and neighbors use it as an excuse not to make dinner at home. Give PCG a try, and it will likely be in your standard rotation, and you won't be disappointed.  The only area I think PCG could improve is with desserts. As good as the meals are, the desserts just aren't as good or enticing- which is not to say they are bad, just not on par with the rest of the place.

5znCJ7J7JgFonSqkc38qfA.text: Been wanting to come here for 20 years so did so today for happy hour. 1.  The place looks real nice but that fly on my pepper shaker drew my attention. 2.  bartender service was good, could have been better if they hadn't been so busy with chores like getting ice, and cleaning.  There were 5 other workers at the entrance standing around talking and doing nothing. 3.  Food here was $8 for a chicken enchilada which was the best I ever had, and the $4 grilled veggie which was OK I guess. 4.  For some reason, happy hours that are on the weekend attracts the old geezers out of their retirement home and there were plenty with blue hair and men wearing shorts with sandals/long white socks.  PLEASE!  Too bad this place doesn't have a reverse later happy hour when real live people come out. 5. If you don't want to drive way over to Snotts-dale to eat, the area north of Camelback and Central  has some good places to eat thanks to  the million dollar homes around here.  This place is worth a visit.  I am going back for another enchilada............

P-d0OiUiob5bbk6sHDRDtA.text: I go to PCG mostly for the corn bread, black bean soup and Macadamia nut chicken.   I tried the brunch menu for the first time today. Delish!! I had the highly-talked-about corn pancakes (w/ bacon). Served w/ real maple syrup, it was the perfect balance of sweet and savory! My friends had the breakfast enchiladas and the beef medallion eggs Benedict. Everything was very tasty! The price point is great too. Most of the dishes were $10.    Here's a tip: the tomatillo salsa served on the enchiladas has small bits of bacon in it. One friend is allergic to pork, and couldn't finish the dish once she discovered it.   This is a place with good food AND great service! I dine at PCG maybe every other month, but for some reason, I went a few times in a few weeks recently. Anyway, the guy that brings water to your table( before the server comes) not only brought the water but brought my "usual" iced tea also.... I was so impressed!!!

IuRWg6eqm1BBYn14WLkYKA.text: I was introduced to PCG by a friend of mine, who frequents this establishment. After my first visit, the staff was so friendly I felt like family. I haven't had a bad thing from their menu, and the happy hour is right on the money!

bjRuXGFwso4iasjDqBNXFw.text: We are tourists just getting some dinner.  This restaurant was fantastic. Price vs quality of food can't be beat.  The server was very nice and the dinner was just the right portions.

4nXQgrvpL_LWnT8ydSrVNQ.text: Hey guys, Stay away from the bar... There is an older waiter who is RUDE and inconsiderate. The food is good, but it is not worth the abuse by the older waiter.... STAY AWAY....  I will spend my money elsewhere.....

HMywh0Eql0pfWlutbSl_rQ.text: Creative entrees that are well prepared with enough on the menu for everyone to find something they like.  I intended on bringing my out of town guest here for Sunday brunch and I like to bring people to anything but a chain.  Thanks to all you yelpers for pointing me here!  I was soooo looking forward to the corn griddle pancakesthat I saw on their online menu.  Just then I spotted a 100% ground chuck burger on the lunch menu - no special beef, no jalapenos on it, just good old chuck, so I had to choose it!  ;)  They have fresh bakery buns and added just the right amount of cheese.  Mmmmmm.  My friends ordered the filet medallian with poached eggs and the other had the pancakes, and we were all very happy.

mg31vx-4rHDCxxt1T4I99A.text: Love this place, we always have a wonderful experience!! Bacon wrapped shrimp and the cheesecake are a must have!!

Yud51AUqKN_qpijOp-hXxw.text: We went to Phoenix City Grill for Christmas Eve Dinner. It was busy but not rediculously so. The hostess staff were helpful and friendly. We had a reservation for 6 people and we were seated promptly. The waitress was attentive and friendly. We ordered off of the special Christmas Eve menu and off of the regular menu. Everything was cooked as ordered and everyone raved about the food. It was a nice evening and we would go back.

AjaSESLRauF04chfoFm5sg.text: No real complaints, just nothing that blew me away.  Decent tap selection.  Decent liquor selection.  Both soups partook were quite good.  Service was quick.  Music was very hip, yet the crowd (at least at the time we were there) was the 40-60 crowd - kind of left me wondering.  We did order an item that was clearly on the happy hour menu (but we didn't know it was on the menu -- i.e. "do you have a -blank- we can order?"), and were told no such thing existed.  Upon leaving, we got a chuckle.  Fathoms of LCD's with sports on, not quite my thing.

hlnTxT_B5s4j2tPvu_6jVw.text: A neighborhood favorite of mine....have enjoyed a visit for dinner or brunch for years.  Highlights- -Quiet atmosphere -extensive beer and wine list -great appetizers---bacon wrapped shrimp, crab cakes and skewers among my favorites -favorite entrees include port tenderloin, various pasta dishes -tortilla soup -love the bread pudding for desert -great service

sYT_GaewI6B6mu_k8ZMs2w.text: OMG - just had their special:  baked cod on mashed potatoes with brussel sprouts and "mom's special bacon vinaigrette".  It was to die for - seriously one of the best fish meals ever.

7Dob5v1d4FnpD_GOpfRMUA.text: I was very content with this place and was going to give it a 4 star but having to pay $10 for an egg white frittata kinda made me not so happy. We came here because we were in the area and ordered the egg white frittata, PCG burger and griddle corn cakes.   Egg white frittata: good but nothing amazing to note.  PCG burger: the the fried jalapenos were made with fresh jalapenoes and since we didn't feel like getting a side of fries, we got a cup of chili for a dollar extra. Overall a large and good burger.  Griddle corn cakes: this reminded me of a tamale without the corn husk. This was probably the best thing we had. This consists of two corn bread-like pancakes that sandwich chicken and cheese, topped with pico de gallo and a side of beans. Together, its a great and delicious combo.  The bill came out to about $40 with tax and tip, the servers were attentive, but the location is a bit hard to find.

zg_F8tQxHC80NbacAhNg3Q.text: I had a dinner date there. Doesn't look too pricy till you get there and you're there in an atmosphere which makes you want to spend a little more and you see their specialty drinks. Very inviting bar area. Next time I go back I want to eat and drink there. Service was pretty awesome, eggplant app was crazy good, and great location to bar hop after a nice dinner. Food was presented well, portion size was ideal, and place was clean. I liked the hints of Phoenix/Desert decor mixed in with some modern items.

5BuInVRmv2Z3WopvqhLR9w.text: Matt and I dined here for our Christmas Eve dinner. Since this was the first time I didn't make the trip home to San Francisco for Christmas, I had absolutely no idea what to do with my Christmas Eve. Matt and I need plans! Therefore, after doing some investigative work on the internet as to what Arizonians can do in Phoenix on Christmas Eve, I came across PCG and their special menu for the holiday. Their prime rib and sea bass specials looked mouthwatering so I made reservations. In the end, this place did not disappoint!! I will unquestionably be back.   I started out with a strong and tart pomegranate margarita that wasn't too sweet. I don't like it when margaritas are sugary so this one was perfect, and a great way to get my Christmas festivities started.   For my main course I opted to try the sea bass special. It came with almond crusted asparagus and some garlicky (and insanely buttery) rosemary mashed potatoes. How would I describe the entire meal? In one word, perfection! That sea bass was so fresh and delicious it practically swam right up to my plate. You can't really go wrong with asparagus but this wasn't just your regular vegetable. They coated the asparagus with a crunchy layer of almonds and it was soooooo tasty. And yeah, the mashed potatoes tasted like they had about 5 cubes of butter in them... but that's the best way to make em!  I wish I had known about this place sooner because it really is such a delightful restaurant. The atmosphere isn't too lively but it isn't too dull. Tons of families, friends and large groups filled the interior so PCG really suits any age demographic. I loved the decorations that they had up for Christmas, and I highly recommend dining here for any holiday. They really do an all around excellent job at providing an awesome dining experience.   When I was there I also noticed that they have a really nice bar with an even nicer happy hour... so once I get the chance, I'm going to head right back here and try it out! Everyone in AZ needs to know about this place. It's one of those solid classic restaurants you can go to for pretty much any occasion. 5 stars to PCG!

i1BfkZQNgebBtMI-hYDXGw.text: My group and I were in the private dining room last week and Britney was our server. I had the pcg pasta and I loved it. The service was amazing, nobody ever had an empty drink and she was always smiling. Will definitely come back with friends and family.

oJpsY8WnKzM0aZnzbdZ_Lg.text: I've never had anything here that I didn't like. I tell people it is fancy versions of comfort food. Their brunch is  amazing - especially the griddled corn cakes and eggs Benedict. Great atmosphere and service.

xNYNZxVa4Alsbe6xoyVqaw.text: Went here for late dinner with friends upon the recommendation of a local.  Unassuming location in a strip mall.  Parking lot was crowded.  Inside was bustling.  Menu had small plates, salads, sandwiches and entrees.  Nice, balanced, without being overwhelming selection.  Burgers were well prepared.  Queso dip was great.  The corncake appetizer was unusual and popular with our group.  Full bar.  Attentive, friendly service.  Prices fair for portion size and quality.  Very nice experience.

K_is836jqsDmG73AcHPnRQ.text: We keep coming back! I love this place. The food is always so good and even when I ask the kitchen for the naked cheeseburger, they make it pretty. And its delish and I love me a cheeseburger. This last time I ordered a vodka tonic and asked the bartender to surprise me - either Belvedere or Ketel. Back came the most frosty delicious Belvedere vodka tonic. Perf. The lovely, as prefers, mans up to the filet. And is always happy, sipping his pinot alongside..   I just wanted to say, yum. And we'll keep coming back. Thanks PCG.

nay_j5g6fbW6UJJ6dV27fw.text: Nice upend, slightly sophisticated feel to this place which I like. I've met friends here for civilized drinks (i.e. wear something other than jeans and a T-Shirt and not having ten drinks and getting smashed) and for dinner. What I like most about this place is the atmosphere and the service. One thing I dislike about Phoenix is that EVERYWHERE is casual. When I come here I like to dress a little nicer and like sitting at the bar having a glass of wine or a nice cocktail rather than slumming it elsewhere over a Miller Lite.  The food is good, not great. I am always bothered by a restaurant whose Surf and Turf is a New York Steak and Shrimp......in my opinion, the "Surf" should always be lobster. Not a deal breaker but that is one offering on the menu that bothered me. The best part of this place is the bar, and you should definitely check it out.

cuYNRbNibDKBtOab8jifLw.text: Stopped in for brunch today.  The eggs Benedict was done very well.  Good service and fair prices.  A nice neighborhood dining option.

IyGZm7x42Yls3GAQbYFbaQ.text: I have been to this restraint 3 different times. I have to start of saying that every time I chose a different plate I was never disappointed . The food is beyond amazing . The service has always been up to my standards witch might I say are very high .  I love the fact that they take reservations witch today is hard to find. The place just has a good vibe while your inside eating and enjoying drinks with your friends . I don't write many reviews however this one was needed . I would recommend this place to everyone and say give it a try you won't be disappointed . Hope this helps you find an amazing place to eat .

5wpujhOZAGaq45Dlf3ev7A.text: I had dinner here with my wife and two children while on vacation. The atmosphere is very comfortable and inviting, and slightly upscale for a place that serves American comfort food. I enjoyed their pot roast, which was very tender and covered in a delicious bourbon gravy. The horseradish mashed potatoes were good, and not overpowering. My wife had the PCG Pasta, which she felt was good but could have been a bit more flavorful. My daughter thoroughly enjoyed the carne asada tacos from the small plates menu. My 8-year-old thought the brioche roll on his hamburger was too crusty, but I took a bite and have to say I disagree. The burger was tender and nicely done, and the bread was just fine.  We also appreciated that they not only have many wines available by the glass, but a broad selection of scotch and bourbon as well, and I happily ordered a glass of Bakers with my meal!

6k4vLL-xyw_gScxZUUb95g.text: A very unimpressive meal today for breakfast. I've always loved PCG, but my service today was a little on the weak side, and my eggs benedict was very disappointing. The hollandaise was super thin and I could detect no taste to it at all. They no longer had the pork tenderloin benedict which is listed on their online menu, but without good hollandaise I doubt that would have been much of an improvement anyway. I think I will stick to dinner here in the future.

yA3AGRMfDYOl9Xic-Na9oA.text: If only zero star was available. After one sip of my drink, I wanted to leave; ordered a Coke but got a flat diet soda. I am allergic to diet soda. The food was just plainly bad. Couldn't wait to get home to use mouthwash and brush my mouth to get rid of the flavor of their food. Please, I am serious, when you want to find a place to go out to eat then go some where else. Not here.

GzEVvPtNpBIQQGy0v_mOeQ.text: I've noticed that as my solidly senior parents get older their taste in food gets pickier.  Due to this, every time I decide to treat them to a meal, I really have to put a ton of thought into it.  I've struck out many times, but hit one out of the field with Phoenix City Grille.  Goat cheese toasts started the show.  The cheese was delicious, with the sun dried tomatoes really giving some depth  Entrees ordered were the pot roast, pasta and an amazing porkchop special.  The pot roast was exactly what I craved, dare I say needed.  It took all the self control I could muster to save some for leftovers (Pot roast sandwich the next day, of course).  The chop was devoured in a frenzy by my normally mellow dad, while my mom eagerly sopped up the pasta sauce.  I still tend to over think meal planning with the family, thankfully Phoenix City Grille has given me a solid option.

tzCJnZdnulsyv4LuefeNug.text: My fiance took us here Saturday night for a dinner date. This was my first time coming to the restaurant. I got the half rack, BBQ baby pork ribs - side slaw, fries, cornbread. The ribs had a nice BBQ with a spice to the dry rub flavor. wine selection was from 7 daughters wine up to some wines from Paso Robles. The ambiance was dim lighting for mood setting. Wood floors, booths or tables. Smaller intimate restaurant, it's tucked in towards the side of the strip mall. You will only see it if you're looking for it or driving up northeast side. I would go back, our waitress was super sweet. Some of the best service I've received for a whole in a restaurant. You can see she is used to her regulars that all knew her well by name, yet with us she also welcomed us in and made us feel as if we could be regulars. She was very friendly and helpful with our menu selections. We would return here in the future.

QjixvXkHJjduAI7Hqa2BkQ.text: Went here for Valentine's Day with my boyfriend. It was our first time there and people ordered the steak and appetizer and a dessert. I thought the meal was excellent very flavorful and worth every penny. The service was good as well. I would definitely go back thank you for a wonderful valentine's Day experience!

bs61FSfir2vqaAW1XPA-hw.text: Been here numerous times over the years and it is consistently good. Nice selection to choose from, and always well presented. My lunch companion ordered the salmon which she said was delicious, and would still be talking about it into next week! I opted for the roasted beet salad with grilled chicken. I know....booorrring. But the greens were fresh, the chicken grilled to perfection, and best of all, the salad wasn't swimming in dressing.  We split a piece of the peach cobbler cheesecake. Our taste buds were absolutely jumping for joy. It was to die for!  Lots of locals frequent this place - and often. It's located in a strip mall in an area that is undergoing a revitalization. Don't let that stop you from trying this place. You won't be disappointed.

JBoWNxsCkQVPRroYdGlsoQ.text: Walked up in here with an empty spot in my belly.. knowing that only one thing would be able to fill this void.. Burger.  Ordered me a damn PCG Burger medium with fries.. and immediately wished I had asked for a rare preparation. I think our server was some sort of Sookie Stackhouse fairy or some shit cuz that burger came to me lightly seared n delicious. Fuckin fried jalepenos, and some green pepper saucy shit all over that beast.   I ate, and laughed loudly with a coworker, and equipment rep.. we pretended we were cavemen huddled around a fire.. dirty, our wives locked up in their respective caves.  PCG did it. They did it right. Our hostess looked like the lady from the pit in Army of Darkness though.. just a little shorter-  One-

RT4wMNCJFEw7QHdNduBEsg.text: We  were greeted warmly by the owners.  The staff was very attentive .surprised that there were no bread or crackers. Ordered their soup which was nice and hot.soup of the day was Paso Le which was broth and spicy.   . Had their burger with blue cheese and fresh jalapenos  it was a little over cooked but good  flavor

z7Sc7xNUVWF4iuGNCtvNoA.text: The atmosphere and the food were exactly what I was seeking. Very comfortable and well priced. They were more that happy to make any changes I desired when I wanted to substitute sides. I can't wait to go back.  I had one of their well-designed burgers - it didn't need a drop of ketchup. The posole soup was also very much on spot. I subbed in the arugula and beet salad and it was a perfect side to that big burger.   The hardest part may be not trying some of the other interesting restaurants in this part of Phoenix.

1gsomN4LNliSbXSWiv4LNQ.text: Terrible service. I came in here not too long ago and a girl name Britney served us. She was awful I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Not only was she rude but the food took forever and was not even worth the wait. Never going back and hopefully the management does something about the service soon..

ck4Kgdz1_cZNIImX94j6Bg.text: The food here is amazing. I can't believe that this was only my first time. The price is very reasonable. I am one that usually leaves some on my plate, and there was no way that I was going to leave anything behind. It was delicious.

IzalchlISU9vC4oBc3aeaQ.text: Great good, service! Servings are large and care to presentation is evident! This restaurant deserves 5 stars!

2K0TOLm8H_ytSpV0kDSXIQ.text: I dined here with my friend a while ago and our experience was delightful completely due to our server, Courtney. She was knowledgeable in suggesting vegan options for me and I ended up loving my meal! And her bubbly personality was an added bonus! Definitely will be back here

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GJ2M9hPFHz5DKx-6S9HZYw.text: I chose Phoenix City Grille for its location and private dining options and was more than pleased by the food and exceptional customer service from beginning to end. Brittnee, Director of Private Dining, was very responsive and helpful for my last-minute booking and server Rhyne was  pleasant and attentive to our group of 15. Just as I hoped, we enjoyed a relaxing family luncheon in a spacious and comfortable room. There were many different meals on table with few leftovers - my Baja shrimp was a good choice, although I may have to go back soon to try the fall-winter vegetable plate. My husband devoured the Arizona Cowboy Steak, a grilled bone-in ribeye that he would never get at home! All in all, a great experience for everyone.

b4O3ombunSdDqmpazUo2Cw.text: Karla was the best. Great ambience. Great experience and my boyfriend was right - great food, comfortable surroundings and fantastic service.

yTA9O-kIbAebI46Mpit6Dg.text: We celebrated a 40th Birthday at PCG. The food and service were fantastic! Brittnee did a great job helping me set up a private room with a menu that was suitable for our guests. What an amazing evening. Thank you to our waitress Tiffany for making sure everything was on point!! We will be back! I would recommend PCG every time.

gMqPMxR4bXE3K7TBxP4r0g.text: Awesome food & great service from staff! Loved local ingredients being integrated into the menu. We will be back soon!

-rdlPzzdJd5-ti1HeKIT7Q.text: I hosted an event in the private dining area for 35 guests.  The room was beautiful, the servers were very attentive to my guests and the food outstanding.  I've been dining here for years and it's one of my favorite places.  I'm getting several texts and calls telling me what a wonderful evening everyone had.  Thanks to all at PCG!

fcHbmwDtNHEnUg-G61tarQ.text: A winner of an evening. I didn't get her name but our server was Perfect!  Attentive but not bothersome. A real pro!  We were meeting family we haven't seen in years so ambience was paramount. PCG did not disappoint. Great wine, food and service. Busy but not packed. Nice place to dine and chat. So many restaurants but still few measure up. !

GZ--tVlPDywbQ6MM11r9aA.text: Their bread rolls and green chili pork with tortillas were one of my most favorite meals lately. We went here early this week and I want to go back today! Just the right amount of spice, fresh tortillas, well flavored pork. A meal to remember!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get the green chili pork. I ordered this as my meal and shared it with myself.

C7_3uaPpN6SSePTI7sXnew.text: Came as a holiday party for my work. We were a huge group of people tucked into a party room . Service was excellent , food was hot & fresh . I had the cheeseburger and sweet potato fries . Both were excellent ! The burger was cooked perfect to order - thick and juicy . Fries were hot and crispy . Also had the hummus and pita app, FANTASTIC !!  I would love to come back on my own and try something else

ayi9YNkCjm1M4b_A2OGTnw.text: Took my Girlfriend to PCG this past Saturday night for her birthday dinner. We were able to make reservations and glad we did. Although the restaurant was busy we were treated as if we were the only ones there. The atmosphere was very accommodating as it was warm, friendly and fun. The Aromas coming from the kitchen we're very enticing. The food looked fantastic. And tasted even better. I asked our server Rhyne if he would mind surprising my girlfriend with the Dozen Roses I bought for her. Rhyne was more than accommodating and brought the roses with her drink as requested. He went above and beyond by putting the roses in a ice bucket and filling it with cold water. Well beyond what we had expected. The portions were just right the taste of our dishes were fantastic and we made reservations to return this coming Saturday with two other couples. Rhyne expressed his pride with his employment at PCG and stated his employer Sheldon the owner works right alongside the crew. Every staff member we saw was smiling yet very busy attending to everyone's requests. You could tell it was a family type atmosphere with all the employees involved. We look forward to our next dinner this Saturday night and we'll be doing a Sunday brunch in the very near future. Thanks again Rhyne for the excellent service. We'll see you Saturday. Tim and Suzanne

A_dVuwrYk0WZQnNdbQpHmg.text: I tried this restaurant for the first time tonight & I had a really great/enjoyable experience.  I Loved the ambiance & bar area. I was really pleased with the plate presentations & flavors of the dishes we chose. We had a really personable and attentive server named Max.  I don't write reviews very often, but this restaurant was really good!

dcNbFPQT1zyTtdLZBuEXww.text: Always good.....great happy hour Mon and Tue Asher so cut he started at sixteen frankie is the veteran worked his way up.... a vareity of food. Anything for anyone's pallet.

7NnFuIVqK5p8gN30sT5DjQ.text: This is a good place to eat. I had a steak sandwich, with cole slaw. I thought it was good. Steak was very tender, served on a roll. Serving isn't to large which in my opinion is good. Have to cut down on my portions. Everything is upscale, even the presentation. I could care less about that. Only thing I care about is taste.  Service was very good, did take a while for the food to come out. However with six of us, we had plenty of talking to pass the time.  Is this a good place to eat? YES! Is there better options? ABSOLUTELY!

9q4bL5aGqBpJO4roE9Jd-A.text: We loved the quiet room and so appreciated the manager turning music off. Tiffany did such a smooth job of meeting all our needs and she was happy and fun. The food was yummy. Interesting salads. My husband's roast chicken with mashed potatoes was so yummy!! I LOVED the squash soup. We'll be back.

5Bs3FttAhlLK2PPB2s4VCA.text: I would never know that this place was here. It's so hidden in the corner.   THE PCG hummus is a must. I would so come here just for the HUMMUS. We came around 7:30, 8 o'clock. It was so dead inside. It was just my boyfriend and I in the  restaurant. My boyfriend joked around and said that he made reservations just for us to dine in the restaurant.. ahha. No. Lolz.  My entree was the crispy eggplant Burger and fries. The fries were so crispy hot and fresh. My boyfriend devoured it.  My burger..... Ehhhh. I don't how I feel about it. I didn't taste the eggplant at all. I taste more of the bread crumbs and the bun than the eggplant. There was also a slice of a thick tomato. I can also taste the tomato, bun and the bread crumbs .. that's it.. there was no spice or flavor to it.   From the outside, you would never know its so spacious and elegant inside. I love the wine bottle area, of course I had to take a picture in front of it. *smiley face*

Wrcrg_CYiF_eehk3d4ZMqg.text: Went for a couple drinks with a friend. Solid selection with great prices. Bartender was very nice and helpful. Would definitely recommend!

BJuOrKgdAgYOFZRg5X62wA.text: It's no wonder this establishment has been in business for so long - same owner for 20 years!  We tried several dishes last night - all amazingly good - then could not resist the bread pudding with Jack Daniels sauce as well as the warm chocolate torte with vanilla bean ice cream - so good!  Our waiter, Ryan, was pleasant, attentive and also knowledgeable about the menu and the wines.  We were so impressed overall that we booked a party of 10 for an important business dinner this week. It will be especially nice because PCG has a private room reserved for us.  I'm sure all of our guests will be very pleased!

bpXA9sQDhMHPEH4tbrVnwQ.text: Legendary. Epic. Amazing. All the above describe this place. I have never rated a place twice but this place warranted it as both times we were here I gave them 5 stars. We got the green chile fondoe, beer short ribs, and Baja shrimp. Everything was so incredibly amazing that this was the best dinner I have had in months. The Baja shrimp with rice, vegetables, and butter sauce we so epic. Omg. I need to come back here sooner rather than later. Thanks for being my new favorite restaurant in Phoenix!
