0do9SJWjDegniqQFqILTpw.text: Stopped in for happy hour and ordered the asparagus and chicken skewers which both had great flavors. Perfect happy hour prices and a nice selection of wines. Picture below was taken before Happy Hour got started.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The place to be for happy hour.

rlqST9rdymfXZtn49z2NwA.text: The private room was perfect for our small gathering and presentation. The owner, Sheldon, was setting up the AV system for us and everyone was so helpful and nice! The food was great, and I will definitely come here next time I am in town. Thank you to all the staff for a lovely evening.

V3RIA7h8QiDFhtZ9fAkjDw.text: So, my fellow yelpers who love happy hours...I have discovered a new happy hour destination! Phoenix City Grill, which sports happy hour from 3pm-close. Yes, til close!!! Sweet baby Jesus, finally someone answered my wishes!   First off, the decor was lovely, as was the ambiance. Happy hour is only available in the bar area, where I quickly ventured to. Some of the happy hour items are: Beef sliders with yummy Tillamook cheese (whaddup Oregon!!!), grilled fish tacos, hummus, Green chile cheese dip, beef and chicken skewers, etc. All in all, a great selection with wonderful execution.   The liquor selection is also solid. Any bar that has items, such as Plum Vodka, gets a thumbs up in my book. The wine selection is also good.   PCG is right off the 51 and also closely located to my dive (yes, my personal dive) the Swizzle.   My only gripe: The bar area was serviced by one waiter - the bartender. So, being that he was making drinks for the restaurant side as well as serving the bar area, the service suffered. He was not nice, inattentive, and at times rude.   I was able to ignore him as the food made its way to my belly.

FVlB2fhBm7pExtP18PF1ew.text: I have driven by this place so many times and said I want to try this place so bad. I have read good reviews and heard good things from friends. Last night I made there. I will return for sure. Its nice inside. The lighting is a little on the dark side which is good with me. The bar is nice but wish there was more seating. I had the pomegranate margarita and oh yeah it was so good. I only had one cause they were $9 then I just went with water. But the cool thing is they have PBR for $2, got to love that and happy hour form 3-close. Yeah I'll be there. The happy hour menu looks great and cant wait to try it out.   So on to the food. I had the Surf N Turf Pasta. Its is Grilled beef tenderloin medallion and jumbo Sea of Cortez shrimp over fettuccine tossed with tomatoes, mushrooms and sweet corn in a green chile butter sauce. It was delicious. The beef was cooked a perfect med rare and the wood grill flavor really came thru. The shrimp were great wish there was more shrimp. I did get the small portion so more shrimp with the large . Small was $14 large is $18. My friend ordered the Grilled Beef Tenderloin which is Wood grilled 8oz. center cut filet with chipotle cheddar stuffed potato and sherry glazed mushrooms. $27 These mushrooms were like candy they should serve them for an app cause I know I'd get them. I wanted to get dessert but I had a long night ahead of me so I will have to get something next time. I did see a few desserts come out and looked great. Overall the place is great and I have a feeling I will become a regular. The server we had was the nicest guy. He was very knowledgeable of all the menu items and answered all my questions without hesitation. Great food, great service, and good ambiance. I cant wait to try the happy hour menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Tenderloin
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. surf N turf pasta

x6i9FrJfBLQO0GtQ3vZr8g.text: Phoenix City Grill is a great lunch spot!! However, the presentation of food is much better when dining in. The to-go boxes and packing is not as nice as one would expect.

FL8smcqg_NA-XgFr4KrSKA.text: The eggplant bites are amazing!  Everything we tried on our first visit was top notch and very reasonable. I am so impressed with/obsessed with their buttermilk pie that I found a recipe online and baked one at home.  Pales in comparison to theirs!  We'll definitely be back soon!

uCaQ1W-YonPmJS8CyKUtPA.text: I would echo many of the positive things others have mentioned about Phoenix City Grille. Everything I had here was just downright good. Ribs were mouthwatering, fall off the bone, marinated fresh each morning and not overcoated, perfect. Really didn't even need the sauce they had such flavor already.  Black bean soup was nice and the chopped salad was real good too with a nice peanut dressing. Nice wine list with plenty of affordable by-the-glass options. And the server we had was nice too, my companion and I stumbled in after a hike to Piestewa Peak and were definitely underdressed, but everyone was nice about it and they clearly wanted out business and valued us as customers.  If I lived in this area of Phoenix, this would be in my rotation for sure.

Ynu-pQf2Y8QjslVCv1ftgA.text: Been here multiple times and the food is always good!  Generous salads, burgers, pasta, desserts, even the house wines are quality.  Nice for groups as you can still hear each other at a table but not so quiet that you feel everyone is listening.  Service is just the right amount of attentiveness and they are able to answer questions which is something not often seen nowadays. There is a back room for groups, have been there too and it is a nice meeting area away from the main restaurant so presentations are okay. Parking is fantastic as the restaurant is located at the end of a strip mall. Recommend.

sk0MUtJFYl-pUEUuOYvGpw.text: My husband and I ate at Phoenix City Grille for the first time on Friday night and we loved it! As we walked in the door we were greeted with a quality aroma that you just don't get from a typical grill. All we knew is that we had to try the ribs and we were glad we did! I had the crusted fish and it was fantastic! The menu had many different price options and that was nice too because sometimes you just want a burger! I think another reason why we will come back is because I saw many gluten free items on the menu. We have a son with Celiac so finding a safe place to feed him is priceless! Also love the combustible to go box!

9vcERHyTsYzD_z0M9dVjtQ.text: My husband and I decided to try a new place for lunch and we are glad we chose this place. We started with the slow roasted beef sliders. The horseradish cream on the sliders was subtle, which I can appreciate. The corn cakes were delicious and very filling. The fish tacos were ok, lacked a little bit of seasoning. We shared the grilled beef tenderloin with mushrooms. The portions were great! I love a restaurant that has hardy dinner dishes for lunch. I'm not stuck ordering a salad, sandwich or burger! We will be back!

3FsONbXyY5iJ1jAmWu9FPA.text: This place is a neighborhood staple. The menu is not my fav (my taste buds only). I sat at the bar waiting for a friend to show up. I think the bartender was new, not just because of the deer in the headlights look on his face, but also the fact that I had to wave him down after about 7 minutes of sitting there. There were 6 specials, 2 which caught my eye. After settling on one, we ordered and were told they were out of 4 of the 6 specials. Might I add it was about 12:15pm. That seemed a little early to be running out of specials. The food we ordered ended up to be OK.   If you haven't eaten here, you must. If given the option I would pick 3.5 stars. This is because of the service and the lack of available specials (maybe cross them off the sandwich board out front when you run out?) I've heard they have a great happy hour and I would definitely recommend the bacon-wrapped shrimp on the app menu.

z385TYPZx1jRDPeChQ9K6Q.text: Not a good place to take your 90 yr. old friend. Please turn up the lights when you have the " Early Dinners"  I'm sorry but four little pieces of bread for SEVEN dollars, really? then to get a special and it has a small piece of fish and about a Quarter cup of salad for $29! Don't get me wrong I'm truly not a cheapskate but in this economy to pay $145 for three dinners, then have to have a snack when you get home is terr able!!   Won't be back!

VXksdsfiGxYn8AiTnMT9OA.text: I went to PCG on Sunday and had the Pork Benedict with Cornbread, which sounded fabulous but was only OK.  The Bloody Marys were delish but really spicy.  We sat outside and enjoyed the good weather but I really wish my breakfast had been more delish.  I will try it again but hope to land on something really good!

5DUVhy8Ty6o7vaPW8_vwMw.text: I was wanting beef short ribs, and PCG was the closest place. I've lived in this area for many years, but this was my first visit.  The on-line menu said short ribs would be $21.  I was a little disappointed to find the price is now $24. I doubt I will reorder at that price.  They were just not that outstanding.

_jlMePYeNRsWaZYk8NU8pw.text: I am stunned to find a poor review of this place.   I discovered this place after I started my current job; the office is down the street and for the last 5 years I've eaten here at least 100 times.    The location is downright bad, there is literally nothing around it that invites you to stop in.  They've been doing a lot of work on the complex lately, adding outdoor seating and it seems to be coming along nicely.  I love a place with a good surprise and when you open the door, a warm, inviting place greets you from a strip-mall parking lot.    The decor is like a Houston's meets southwest.  It's a great place for business lunches, ask for a table in the back near the mirror or a booth.  The bar is also a great gathering spot for coworkers, clients or friends.  It's classy and there's variety for everyone.  I love bringing out-of-towners here for a neighborhood culinary treat with a southwestern flair.    The staff is friendly, genuine, always helpful and appreciative of your business.  I can honestly say in 5 years I have never had bad service.   The wine list has enough variety to not be overwhelming, beers on draft feature some local and microbrew varieties, martinis are perfectly crafted and not over-shaken.   The food- oh the delicious food.  I love that the chef tries to use as much local, fresh ingredients as possible.  He is consistently featured as a supporter of local farmers.    I think it's a summer special but lately Monday's have been happy hour til close with $3-$6 full-size apps and $5 glasses of wine- seriously there is not a better deal in town with this quality of food.    Bacon wrapped shrimp:  these little suckers are rich but delicious.  They are filled with some sort of southwestern cheese and served with a creamy sauce and cabbage slaw.  Mix them all together in one bite and the smoky bacon, plump shrimp, creamy cheese, cilantro cream dip and cold, crisp cabbage are a treat for your mouth.   They are pretty decadent so be prepared.   Griddled Corncakes: Holy heaven on a plate.  Imagine moist, tasty cornbread, only flattened out like a pancake.  Then, stack them with deliciously smoked pork and mexican cheese (not too much) and place them on a bed of black beans.  This is the dark horse of the menu.  They can easily be a meal and for $5 at happy hour one helluva deal.  It becomes a little tricky to share with more than 2 or 3 but worth every bite.  Queso Fundido: light, creamy, consistency without gross chunks or a heavy oily topping like other places; just a nice mixture with just the right kick.  Chips are thin, crispy and always fresh and hot.    Goat Cheese Crostinis: eh. these are ok but I think time and money are better spent on other items.   Fish Tacos:  THE BEST IN TOWN.  First, they actually cook the tortilla- novel concept.  Second, it's a perfect portion of moist, grilled, flavorful fish.  Third, topped with loads of fresh toppings- pickled red onions, shredded cabbage, delicious sauce, fresh house made salsa....for $5 and you get two??? I'm so hooked.  Spinach salad: fresh and always delicious.  I recognize a lot of the ingredients from farmers market and love it. I take any opportunity to consume the homemade couscous.  Bethany Chopped: I order it with the peanut and sesame dressing on the side.  The shaved chicken, crispy tortilla strips all mixed in are superb.   CHILI: I anxiously await the first cold, chilling day of the winter where nothing sets you straight like a good bowl of chili.  Holy hell this is amazing.  Lots of smoked pork, just the right amount of beans, a spice that keeps you coming for more and to boot, a pickled relish and slice of cornbread to accompany it.   Black bean soup/ Tomato basil soup/ Daily (Thu?) green chili:  always tasty, comforting, nice layers of flavor and great texture.  CHEESEBURGER:  I don't know how this one escaped Seftel's list...seriously.  It's rich, delicious and downright divine.  Order it as is and you won't be sorry- cooked medium it's the best I've ever had.  The french fries are thin and crispy but still filled with soft, tender potato.   Chicken sandwich: always moist, large, clean cut grilled breast, great toppings.  Coleslaw: fresh, nice balance of zing and creamy but not too much.    Daily Catch: This is what I typically get because I like to experience whatever the chef has for the day.  I always go crazy for the couscous and have honestly never been disappointed with the daily catch- sometimes it's a bit adventurous but I always welcome it.    Cowboy Steak: If I ever want to bribe my husband into ANYTHING, I dangle the Cowboy Steak in front of him.  I'm not kidding, it's better than anything I could offer.  Full-flavored ribeye on a bed of that pork/bean/chili tastiness + jalapeno relish = OMG

Ri9wWyhe6E5wuYCHktkMGg.text: 3.5 stars. Decent upscale American restaurant catering to older steak/seafood eaters.  I went there for a work dinner with 10 people and was pretty excited at first with its slick interior design and good looking menu, but was consistently let down throughout the evening.  I got my first warning sign as I started looking around looking at the clientle. It looked someone started handing out 50 dollar gift certificates for PCG at Luby's the night before. With a crowd that old and tame, I knew the food wouldn't have as much flavor as I look for.  Next, my pomegranate margarita arrived which tasted likely what pomegranate kool-aid would taste like if they made such a thing. I'm not sure if it even had alcohol in it. I switched to their draft beers which are from several small breweries and much more worth your time.  Next came my Ahi Tuna special which was definitely not worth the price tag. Very bland. Didn't seem like they should even be serving it if they don't know how to make it interesting. Although the rice side dish that came with it was great. Other's in my group who had steak, salmon, and such were much more pleased.  I gave them a chance to redeem themselves with their Croissant Bread Pudding which sounded phenomenal, especially to a bread pudding man like myself. Again it was fairly par for the course and not worth its price tag. The bread pudding at Sonora Brew house is worlds better for less money.  It seems like a great place to take your parents or people who like meat without much spice and drinks without much alcohol, but it's definitely not a place for me.

hlDc3YVYrGQgi4PxiXZ5pA.text: Beware of the high cost of corn bread.  My husband and I have been to Phoenix City Grille twice before.  It's really great.  They have a wonderful happy hour and we went for brunch on Easter of last year when our first place brought out a plate of food that had gum on the plate.  (Rule #1 - Never put your gum on the plate.  It doesn't wash off or scrape off that easily. You are a lowly human being if you put your gum on your plate or linen napkin.  Use a disposable napkin or tissue.  Karma will pay back the people who leave gum on plates.)    Our first two trip to Phoenix City Grille were great.  Friendly staff, delicious food, reasonably priced, and truly great happy hour.  This past visit left a lot to be desired.  Our server was friendly enough, (I believe her name was Sonya).  We ordered our drinks which she brought out quickly.  We ordered our food, and then waited.  The table next to us that was sat after us got there food first.  Not that big of a deal.  Then we asked for some cornbread.  Both times we were there before it was brought out to the table just a few pieces for my husband and I to enjoy.  We thought it was odd we had to ask for it.  She offered us individual pieces, or a skillet.  We asked or a skillet.  At no point did she mention that a skillet of corn bread was $10.  It wasn't until we got the bill and had to track down a manager that we learned if you order (yes order) the corn bread in individual pieces, then it is free.  However they charge for a skillet. I don't recall seeing anything on the menu that said cornbread in a skillet - $10.  The manager was gracious enough to reverse this over sight, but we did not see our server again for the rest of the time we were at Phoenix City Grille.  Another server, not even the manager who resolved our cornbread issue brought us our check, ran the card, and returned the check for us to sign.   Things happen.  Sonya didn't mention the up charge for whatever reason, we disagreed that we had never had that happen before, and the she vanished.  I was a server for years.  People don't always agree with how a business is run, and it's the job of the front line (the servers and front of the house staff) to inform guest of what things cost wither by having a price on a menu, or by telling them up front.  I'm disappointed that the felt she had to run away from us. We'll go back, but now we know, beware of the cornbread up charge.

ljod27WxoT1G-k1LqLxd7Q.text: Service is excellent but I tried the corn cakes that everyone is raving about and I just don't get it. They are like pancakes, but with some veggies between them, kind of like an omelette... and then there's some pico de gallo thrown in (that was good) and served with syrup. Just my personal preference, I guess, all of those flavors didn't blend well for my taste. However, the bloody Mary was tasty and at $4 is a steal on a Sunday morning! My companions had the crab cake benedict and the bread pudding french toast (more like a dessert than a breakfast), both were excellent.

WtMkP9ZO6iPA7rcwPokBSw.text: This place has long been one of my favs, whether getting take out or dining at the restaurant.  The cedar planked salmon, pot roast and griddle corn cakes never fail to satisfy.   Last night, however, made me fall in love all over again!  The croissant bread pudding with the Jack Daniels sauce and the pumpkin cheesecake completely stopped the normally frenzied conversation at our table.  My dining companions and I sheepishly looked at each other as if we had been caught doing something illegal or immoral!  It was almost embarrassing how good these two items were!!!  The luxurious textures, the perfectly balanced flavors, the butter infusions!  Trying to figure out how I can go back in tonight and just do the deserts...

xxBUvEiKWMyPPRGtaK417A.text: I finally get back to town after my month-long trip and head out to eat, only to be underwhelmed by a restaurant that everyone on this site loves.  Day two back from vacation: I've gotta make up the debacle from the night before to the hubby.  So, despite an inch of rain falling during the time it took us to drive from Van Buren to Bethany Home, we decided to keep going up to the Phoenix City Grille.  And I'm so glad we did.  I had been here a few times, thanks to the corporate overlords of the funeral home I worked at just up the street.  But, at the time I was a vegetarian and not astounded by the menu (embalming and meat eating just don't mix in my eyes).  Thankfully, I gave up my veggie tendencies, because the food here is incredibly delicious.  The husband loved his burger sans bun and claims that it was the best burger ever.  SCORE!    Oh yeah, and my meal was phenomenal too.  Super juicy pan-fried chicken and horseradish mashed potatoes.  The horseradish had no kick to it, but the flavor was definitely there.  I suppose if I could offer advice to the awesome chefs at PCG, I would suggest adding a splash of horseradish on top.  But I really love that sinus-clearing sensation of good, fresh horseradish.  Regardless, the meal was fantabulous.  The service was wonderful and the atmosphere is calm and cozy.  The menu is a smidge pricey, I won't be making a habit out of PCG, but it will be one of my reward restaurants.

WTfhCieSN5cAIIALPAuZuA.text: This restaurant is one of our favorites in town!  The service is top notch and the food is wonderful.  Thanks for being one of the most reliable, friendly restaurants in Phoenix!!

Nbl95vozt7BRN1GI_hHCiQ.text: PCG is an excellent place to relax for brunch. You will find courteous staff, excellent table service, and good food. The environment was very laid back and relaxing. Definitely worth checking out if your in the area.

m4lEy5Bu0QAsNGjbFShK6Q.text: What can I say about my local happy hour/dinner favorite in Phoenix. They effectively cover all the bases for a great local resto. Chef prepares great apps, get on the email list if you are not already, and has a perfect range of entries that cover most appetites. Food is always prepared perfectly and the bar is a great place to gather. Can't go wrong here. Planked Salmon, bacon wrapped shrimp and the Hummus plate are faves!  Get some!!

TwM-DDDJlicnLGFw1JKnZQ.text: My First time to PCG. Loved it! I had the Cedar Planked Salmon (very good)  it came with roasted fingerling potatoes and a green salad with lots of beets. Their homemade tarter sauce was different, but Awesome. My husband had the Rose Lane Chicken he said " it was Really good". The staff there was very friendly and the noise level was low.

McRmXcWg9ukGbQHZx0Ql_A.text: I was invited to brunch with friends who are regulars. I've passed by this place a bunch of times. It's in a strip mall and doesn't look like much from the outside but when I walked in I was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance was casual with a touch of elegance. Our server was Nina who was delightful and pleasant. I decided on an Arnold Palmer for a beverage although my peers were having bloody mary's and mimosas. I decided on the breakfast sandwich and asked that it be served on the gluten free hamburger bun. It was one of the tastiest breakfast sandwiches I have ever had. A couple friends had the "catch" of the day which I believe was salmon and they enjoyed it. I will absolutely be back.

PTsrpDyuD7ngkj2MetZYpA.text: We had a rehearsal dinner there in October of 2016.  The event coordination went well and everything was ready for us upon arrival.  The space was perfect for our group of about 25.  They had a projector to play video and the room was noise proof.  All of our guests agreed the food was excellent and the service was great.  They were very accommodating.

4xMP6r3Chfh5tREmHhuh0A.text: I have been a regular now at the Phoenix City Grille for at least 12 years. I always love their food and service and IMHO always has been one of the better place to go during weekend restaurant rush hours. The owners are nice and always friendly and always make me feel at home. Make sure you try their Hummus which is delicious. Thank you PCG!

8XEz_HJe6tRaY0f5pL0Bhg.text: Reserved their private room for a birthday celebration. The planning, service and entire event was Outstanding! Brittannee organized the event, Courtney was our server and the manager was on site to check on things. Appetizers, drinks and food for 23 people --- all perfectly presented!!!

jW9IRpX5pJF4N_y1-no7AA.text: Came in today for lunch rhyne was our server he was attentive friendly and informative the l dish I ordered was delicious but to spicy rhyne offered a better option and brought out my replacement rite away the food was very modern and delicious and very high quality this place has something for everyone we will be back soon ... oh yea the cucumber martini is extraordinary

PUfHa9t0MMMtAPoJaxU6dg.text: Phoenix City Grill is our family "go to" spot when we're looking for delicious food, relaxing ambiance, and service that never disappoints. While dependable may not sound flattering, it is certainly one of the great adjectives we use to describe all facets of their operation. The Knapps have carved out a loyal, trusting follower of neighbors and referrals over the years and it's where we head with out of town guests, or family functions to enjoy their extensive menu. My favorite, the bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer. I order a double and it's a marvelous feast. Thank you Sheldon!

vfT6MIpFOX3Ix3nz_lQEQg.text: Love, love love this restaurant. Casual, friendly and consistent. The food choice is eclectic Southwest and always good. If you are in the mood for a pub this is it. I go all the time. Judy Wolf

OzAvJchovosmGQFQoJ-LnQ.text: Great place. Friendly staff. Excellent food. We to 3 teenagers and they loved it. Good cocktails too.

ITdbg0HCgeIjJ3h3YoRYoA.text: Great place for a large party! Staff was friendly and efficient with a group of 45. They had drinks and dinner to us quickly. Refilling drinks constantly. Really on point with service! And of course food was phenomenal!!

2mr_QVkDf92nbtso7GNRWg.text: My coworker and I stumbled upon this place looking for a nice place to eat near our hotel. Everything was fantastic! Our waitress, Kathryn, was well informed and was able to give us recommendations based on our preferences. We even had a great chat when the restaurant was slow.   We both tried the green chili posole special, and loved the presentation and flavors. For our entrees, we recommend both the roasted beet salad and the grilled beef tenderloin (especially the chipotle cheddar stuffed potato side). Our waitress offered us a complimentary dessert for our first visit and highly recommended the croissant bread pudding, which was amazing. My coworker was very impressed by the gluten-free options on the menu, as her husband is gluten intolerant.   As I am a frequent Phoenix visitor, I will definitely be returning. Thanks for the great service and meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Croissant Bread Pudding
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Beef Tenderloin with Chipotle Cheddar Stuffed Potato

7UfZciQuKdcbjUIiAmmF5Q.text: I specifically went here for the pasta dish I had eaten here several years ago, closer to the time they had opened. I remember having ordered it a couple of times and thinking it was one of the better pasta dishes I'd had. The PCG Pasta I had the other night was good, but definitely not what I remember from back in the day. Not that chefs aren't allowed to change things up, but if they can archive the recipe from 2010-2011, it would be so much better! Regardless, the atmosphere and service is always good...I will return and have something else.

ZEdA8VkG4-SBNOuXfN1MgQ.text: Very nice. We entered through the back door, which had us pass through the kitchen, past the bar, and up to the host stand. Restaurant is tastefully decorated with lots of comfortable seating.  The crispy eggplant sandwich is wonderful. The eggplant is definitely crisp, not soggy, and the accompanying goat cheese is just the right amount of creamy, rich texture and flavor without weighing the sandwich down. The sweet potato fries are also seasoned perfectly.  The chipotle BBQ burger is really good. The onion rings on the burger are fantastic, but the overall burger is a little too salty for my personal taste. Still, it was very nice, and the french fries are good.  Service was pretty good. We had a nice time and I think we'll definitely be back.

0dDMsFSVfvtVIUx5EU3sxg.text: Went here today for the first time. Everything was excellent. My boyfriend  had a salad (I don't remember which one) and I had the eggplant sandwich and upgraded my side to a salad. He had a beer and I had a glass of wine. The food and drinks were reasonably priced, the service was great, and the food was really really good! We will definitely be back!

ZDYMs-v4Z3Jgr35ETCd9dg.text: lunch sat. 6/23: service great, as usual, quest fundido very good, as usual, bloody mary hit the spot, the bihn mi sandwich not so much, s'posses tone tasty and spicy  - it wasn't, little meat, lots of bread, disappointing. fix it or nix it. chocolate torte was real good. still one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants for years.

CoTKegxT02tCljRjH_eUXA.text: Just stopped in for free lunch for Veteran's Day. I had the 16th St Burger and Horseradish Mashed Potatoes. WOW! I sat at the bar. The service was awesome and everyone made a point to thank me for my service. Feeling proud after this visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16th St. Burger and Pumpkin Porter. Free Veteran&#39;s Day Meal... Thank you.

JiT6zRGsqHhYP2FGLQ2FyA.text: Not even worth it. The entire crew was unprofessional and my chicken tasted like fish. Didn't even know who was my server. Plus only saw 2 people; one who gave me my drink and meal then did a Houdini and disappeared. The next was the person who  gave me my bill. That's it!! No one even asked" ohh how was your meal, or is everything ok".  I don't understand what the rave is all about, I Will never go back. If I could have rated it a minus 5 stars I would have.

MUaSjSHTzHrQpVOE35Gz_g.text: What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said. It is a solid restaurant. The food is great, the service is always attentive and friendly, and it is always clean and well kept.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu!

cxtETlimT55I_IbbIqlziw.text: Having a wonderful time at Phoenix City Grill today  picture of our server wonderful girl a lot of fun

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RTlOB1DbDjTu9ne8SY7l1Q.text: I love PCG! It has to be my favorite restaurant, aside from Houston's. The brie appetizer is soooo yummy. And last week I tried the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich. It was sooo good. The bacon wrapped shrimp is good, but after two, you feel a little weighed down. It had some type of white cheese in it- not necessary. I shouldn't have tried it anyway- I am trying to be a fishetarian. They have great simple salads. And the cedar plank salmon is absolutely my favorite menu item. mmmmm.....

CyONcU2GZULMXHMFNvBPFA.text: Located on the SW corner of 16th St. and Bethany Home Rd. in a strip mall.  Great casual dining in a soft desert toned ambiance; ample portions of really good home cooking served with flair (presentation is everything) at moderate prices.  What more could you ask for? Oh, wine you say?  Well here you go - a comfortable little bar area (yes, cocktails too) in which to chill out at day's end and catch the ball game of the day or vent about work.  Or alternately makes a great place to do business or dare I say - meet a date?

Y__28F35ojhY8ZOrC7kh7g.text: Surly, poor service - we spotted a couple of thick gray-white hairs floating on top of my girlfriend's wine. After scowling at us for bringing it up, the new bartender from Flagstaff poured out the wine and then informed us that these were tiny strands of cheese from our con queso, which my girlfrind didn't touch and was about 2 feet away from her. It is obvious when you have hairs in your drink! In attentive service from that point on, but when we left after awarding the bartender the 5% tip (more than he deserved) he pursued us down the sidewalk to the south, outside the building by walking along the plate glass windows on the inside, banging on them alongside as we walked.  What a weird experience! Been going here for years and years, some of their dishes are quite good, others not so hot; wine list pretty indifferent and slipping. But this kind of behavior is a game changer. I will never go back.

BpH1-Uk3QpRhYfKDXBoUvA.text: I really like lunch here. The prices are reasonable and the menu is varied enough to pique my critical interest. I had a seasonal salad with local grown varietal tomatoes, roasted beets (a weakness of mine), and Queen Creek olive oil which is usually spectacular, but this time was sort of ordinary. I opted for the beef  fillet add-onto protest against vegetarianism. It was medium rare, tender, and very good. The salad had some lump of bread but I didn't eat it. My friends had the portobello burger and the black bean soup and both were very happy. I will be back next week for another lunch and will write a follow up.

iLne5EYVQ6_JdWwZvrLSOQ.text: I have been coming here for YEARS and am sad to say that until I ate another amazing lunch there today, it never occurred to me to write a review.  Every meal I have here is better than the last, it's ALWAYS consistent, and the menu has something for everyone.  My personal faves are the black bean soup and the Bethany Home Chopped salad (and I'm not really a salad kind of gal :)!!!).  But don't shy away from the ribs, OMG is all I can say, or the PCG pasta.  Come to think of it, any PCG virgin I've taken here has raved about it and become a novice themselves :)! Add in the full bar and great wine list, this place is a MUST for a constantly consistent great meal! In regards to the attire i chose dressy because if you came on a weekend night in jeans and flip flops you may feel under dressed, but you could absolutely go jeans and flops during the day for lunch (as I did today)! Happy eating!

sKw3FW7GYUYGgZoa5sl2dw.text: My wife and I were on a roadtrip. Got off the plane in Phoenix and rented a car to goto Sedona and Grand Canyons. It happened to be Sunday morning, we stopped at PCG and they were serving their brunch menu. It was one of the best brunch we've ever had. I had the stuffed french toast, my wife had some type of egg white omelet. The food and service was really good and they offered special drinks such as $3 mimosas. I highly recommend this place.

ZI5VxK4aDUamqXIkwIBH9w.text: I've only been to this place once so far on a business lunch  with clients  while on my vacation. It was pretty crowded, wait was about 5 mins as we had a reservation. I had the Bethany Hope salad, less the tortilla strips. I thought it was really delicious. I had enough of a craving for that salad to want to come back within the week. Never made it however. It was about 115 degrees, hot outside and the salad was refreshing and different. Everyone else loved what they had. chef salad and a sandwhich. They had specials, but they were no longer available in the kitchen - ran out of ingredients - due to high demand. Again, the place is quite popular. Overall, very satisfied with my visit, though the service we recieved was less than polite. She showed up to take orders and only appeared with the drinks, food, and the bill. The place has a real easy-going vibe, un-pretentious and inviting. Not your Red Robbins but not as high maintenance as City Hall in Scottsdale.

2ZhhCfAIMBcR-BIT8AIWzQ.text: Heard about this place for some time, and my neighbor is a big fan of the Monday night happy hour deals, so I decided to give it a whirl with the gf.  Our hunger couldn't wait til nighttime, so we hit it up for a late lunch. Holy YUM!  Bacon-wrapped shrimp: giant shrimp stuffed with cotija and crispity delicious bacon. A heart-stopper, for sure, but damn, sooo good. We then split a blue-cheese wedge salad and a green chile burger, and both were perfectly put together, fresh and delicious.  Green chiles could have had more heat to them, but that burger was cooked perfectly, not too greasy, juicy bites on a nice firm roll that held up all the way through. And great pickles, too.  Would have liked a nice IPA offered on draft, as opposed to the bottle option, but other than that, we really dug it. FABULOUS service by Karla, who left us alone just enough, but was always ready to freshen up our waters or make sure we were enjoying our food.

vlObo-vLnh5XHcJMkjNb9w.text: Went here several weeks ago. My one complaint is that it is TOO dark. The food was okay, nothing special. The staff was wonderful and very attentive.

-C07tZ9uQ8dIYyBjbRQmxA.text: My hubby and I love to go to PCG for our date nights. He introduced me to PCG when we were first dating. It's a romantic place if you're away from the bar. The pot roast is to die for and I even love the horseradish in the mashed potatoes...although I admit I had to try it a few times before it grew on me when they changed the recipe. Finish it off with the incredible Bread Pudding and you will be hooked. My hubby has had the salmon and chicken and really enjoyed those too. We always get the nicest servers. We've never had anything but a great experience there!

K020LadM1yoLj-uOaLij6A.text: Updated menu and one of the best dinners and evenings we've had in a long time.  Thank you Sheldon for your brilliance.

iA8nZnzn1JjWkEeaeqRZDg.text: From preplanning to execution every detail was coordinated with the lovely Brittnee Reed, who allowed us to preplan our orders due to time sensitivity.  We only had an hour and a half to celebrate our employee's retirement, and we had a lot planned.  All my requests and expectations of the PCG were exceeded.  The orders were coordinated with the chef and the food came out on schedule.  Not to mention everything was delicious.  Our wait staff was amazing; I believe our server in charge was Samantha (lovely as ever).  The bill arrived and was exactly what was expected.  Checkout was a breeze.  The pre coordination of lunch service allowed us to focus on celebrating our employee.  It was fabulous!  Thank you.      Michelle

_fBOt9mwqfd4xJ56oOCUFg.text: Everytime I've been here, the food is consistent, great tasting and a nice atmosphere to relax.  Wine selections are very good.  I highly recommend for lunch or dinner.

_8-d6QrEhYeEDTyJ_ovriQ.text: Huge thank you for all involved in our family Christmas dinner! Brittnee was amazing at coordinating all of our needs and adjusting the set menu for us. Courtney was a great server who took very good care of us. The food was amazing. We had a really lovely evening!

5q4Zpmi0_H5OKzEsNfsWNw.text: The restaurant is very nice. The staff were accommodating. Service was great.  They did not hold back with the liquor in there drinks. The dessert menu did not have that much variety but that was not a big deal to me. I would say it was reasonably priced. I would recommend this restaurant.

PjO1RrGmGBkecef2mwaD8Q.text: I called an order in yesterday... not expecting it to be all that amazing...   Boy was i wrong... this place is beyond delicious. I had my partner pick up the Baja shrimp and the pan chicken and we also got the tacos and there was nothing that was bad... from start to finish the food was beyond amazing and the service was so up to par staff was friendly and welcoming... def need to check it out

j5fjrDFs2e4Y7GDKNJbkAw.text: The first time I tried PCG they were doing some promoting at the peak six apartment complex off of 16th st and camelback. There were many different restaurants promoting that day but PCG stood out the most! They were sampling shrimp wrapped in bacon and let me tell you I fell in love!! I definitely would recommend this restaurant!!

9NAzSfV_SYpmDkY9GzXPqQ.text: We got there early enough to experience the bar and restaurant alone. Very clean and great ambiance. The staff was polite and friendly with great suggestions for food and drink.  This place has a great "neighborhood bar" feel to it. So much so that we might consider moving out that way.

DZDoXXiUNtI8Z80kKIscGQ.text: Met a book club here.  Nice attentive service.  Allowed us to chat and didn't rush.  Despite the fact they were closing.   The food was very good.  I had the Salmon and it was yummy.  Not fishy, well seasoned and perfectly cooked.  Others had the shrimp which they devoured, so it must have been yummy!   Not close to mg home, but if it were, I'd be a regular!

cOg6-ReceaswIAYhA2yxHA.text: Because I've never been that impressed with the food at Happy Hour, I've never really wanted to try dinner at Phoenix City Grille so I've only tried them for dinner one time.  In the almost 4 years I've been here I've tried Phoenix City Grille for happy hour 3 times.  They have a nice red wine selection and the Martinis are pretty good, especially for $6 bucks.  The prices are really good for happy hour ranging from $4 - $6.  In the three times I've been to PCG I've tried the Sriracha Honey Glazed Short Ribs, Bacon wrapped shrimp, Soy Ginger Glazed Beef & Chicken Skewers and Sweet Potato Fries.  I'm only a fan of the Sweet Potato Fries and Short Ribs to be honest.  Both the bacon wrapped shrimp and the skewers were way too salty to me.  The last time I had the skewers I couldn't get through my order.  I will say, every time I've been to PCG it was a pretty packed house.  Not crowded but pretty packed. The one time I had dinner at PCG I ordered the short ribs.  They are SUPER good.  Just not as good as mine which is why I've only had them one time ... I think mine are better   For those looking for HH place sin Central Phoenix this place has Happy Hour from 3pm to close every Monday and Tuesday.  Wednesday through Sundays, HH is from 3 - 6pm.

72VZ2zQqHPisMx7hrbIdmg.text: I've been here twice for dinner and both times the food was amazing. I had the roasted chicken and horseradish mashed potatoes, delicious!! I want to come back and check the happy hour out sometime. Classy older feel to the dining room.

kj3wev7OJfEIr3vGkzuhsA.text: This place is awesome. Wonderful ambiance, food is fabulous, and very pleasant servers.

zFMWr77dPNZeofUYerYaYA.text: This has been on my try list for quite some time, but there are SO many restaurants in the valley that it took me forever to get over to Phoenix City Grille. So now comes the True question-how on earth have I lived in Phoenix for 2 years and just now had the chance to dine at this establishment?  What was I thinking waiting so long?!! This place is fantastic!  I've had several misses at restaurants where I feel something was lacking, be it service, flavor, value...not here.  We enjoyed an exceptional evening out at the Phoenix City Grille.  Started with drinks and my glass of wine was a very generous pour (this mama was happy-I like my vino).  We also had the Griddled Corn Cakes and the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp as appetizers.  They were absolutely delicious.   For entrees our table had a variety of steaks-all cooked perfectly.  I personally had the Eggplant Sandwich.  OMG.  There are no words to describe the sandwich, but I will say it is probably in my top 20 best things I've ever eaten.  I told the server 'if I were a sandwich this would be me'.  The flavors were out of this world.   Too stuffed to try dessert but I know 100% I will be returning soon.  Our service was fantastic as well.  Our party of 6 were all extremely pleased!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggplant Sandwich.  I am going to dream about this.

S4TfCFchoFO3K6WZAwlZ4A.text: I'm a regular and I drive 35 minutes to get there! Believe me, it's worth the drive. You can't go wrong with the Rose Lane Chicken! The carne asada special was so good! I only pray it becomes a regular menu option! Ugh, everything is always GREAT! One of my top 3 favorite places to eat in AZ!!

5CrSezpi9uGoAlhjY9iPbQ.text: Ive been here a hand full of times. The first time was for Happy Hour with coworkers and I absolutely loved it. Food was great, service was great, everything was exceptional. I decided to bring friends with me on the next visit and we were rushed to the point where it was extremely obvious. Our server made us fill as though we were a nuisance. Through it all we still left her a 20% tip. I chucked it up to them being really busy, server having a bad day, etc. The third visit I went with some friends and they wanted to put our table of 5 in the back corner room closed off from the rest of the restaurant. We requested a table in the dining area like everyone else. It took a few minutes for the hostess to discuss it with either who I think was the server or manager. I just told her nevermind on the table and we went across to The Vig. At that point I just gave up on PCG.

IPAM_bi1zZHuEaPFAX4ccw.text: Delightful experience for our group of six.  We so appreciated their willingness to arrange several tables together, and in a quiet area.  Everyone was pleased with the delicious food and excellent service.  We will be back!

DVoj_NBV-BEFLKKNG1GSfQ.text: I had brunch today and loved the food. I ordered the corn cakes and never experienced a variety of flavors in one bite. Each bite willed me to slow down to experience this taste of perfection. I will definitely go back. Great portion size and pricing. Bravo!

W0rABau6_tDu4fBjP4eAWw.text: This is a great date night spot!  The ambiance was relaxing and romantic. I had the short ribs which kind of reminded me of homemade pot roast.  Not really how I expected it to taste but it was filling and very good. The hubby had the ribs which were fall off the bones kind of ribs and that's always the best kind of ribs with a side of bbq sauce. Tip for the server: The servers were attentive, not smothering but friendly - that's how you get great tips !

IhzQm2VkzQdj5mjm-iVmZQ.text: Look no further, this is the best restaurant, hands down located at 16th Street & Bethany Home Road in Phoenix. Family owned and operated,  attention to detail, ambience and food consistently wonderful servers are terrific as is everyone here.  A restaurant that plays music, a great selection without ever drowning out your conversation. You can't go wrong, everything for the vegetarian to the meat eaters, find it here at PCG.

J-qiAnAEDfQptsXXcSthbw.text: Great food, great atmosphere, AMAZING staff.  Went here today for a BDay celebration lunch  w/ 2 workmates that have never been here B4.  WINNER!!!  Sat at the bar...had a blast.  Everyone was thrilled w/their lunch choice (is it possible to go wrong here?  Think not!) and cocktail (I did say BDay, right?)  We'll all be back.

_swFqrqqHi7wLM8U6c8UuA.text: Excellent gourmet-level fare served up with friendly and professional service.  Great business lunch spot!  Everything we had was tasty and spot on.

WCmkrJItGuyZ0f66imDSVA.text: One star for service. 4 for food. I didn't want to write this review. But I'm finding myself still fuming about it. I went to dinner with my young son a few nights ago. We don't go out to dinner often because I work in the industry at a local restaurant and I work nights. I'm also a single mom who goes to school almost full time. I chose this place because I live near by and I've heard great things about the food.   We arrived around 6:30 and things did not look too busy. Ten or so tables inside and one on the patio. No one was at the host stand and it took several minutes for someone to finally come. I asked for us to be seated on the patio and was told to have a seat and the hostess would follow me with menus. We found a table and after a solid two minutes no one brought menus. I finally got up and got them myself. After that it took over five minutes before the server came to the table. No smile. And very little eye contact. Quickly took our drink order and returned with drinks fairly promptly. The server then took our order without a smile, suggestions, or personality. I asked if they had a kids burger( I'm not complaining that they didn't) and the server said "you want cheese on it?" No yes or no. Just asked about cheese. I don't know if they were in a hurry or what. The food came and it was really delicious. The server came to check on us and said "good stuff guys?" As they were walking away. At the end of meal the server never asked if we wanted dessert and took my payment. Then returned it with a very quick "goodnight". Never took my empty plate and I had to move it to sign my credit card slip. The service was an epic fail from start to finish. NEVER SMILED. I'm pretty easy to please honestly. I will probably be back for the food, but not for awhile. And if that same server is anywhere in sight, I will specifically ask not to be seated in their section. It's unfortunate that the service alone ruined a rare night out for my son and I.

4y5Llh0SXtOJHOp9mkOnKw.text: Our company threw two events in the banquet room this week and the food and the service from our server Britany was top notch.  All of our invited guests had a wonderful experience from both dining and service perspectives.  Well recommended, particularly enjoyed the short ribs.

vca_wigfNTCQvZsehGNDTw.text: Still delicious, still one of my staples.  Went here for date night last week.  It's a good spot for that - you don't have to dress up, but you can if you want, and it feels intimate at a 2-person table.  We tried the croissant bread pudding - it was the best I've ever had.  Highly recommend it, even if you don't think you're a bread pudding fan!

54woFOeU7WtvAyitROMedg.text: Not too impressed.  I'll start with the good.  The restaurant had a very good vibe.  I had several conversations with interesting and intelligent people in the bar.  However none of those were people that worked there.  First it took precisely 8 minutes and 38 seconds for someone to ask me if I would like a drink.  And that is when things took a turn for the worse.  I said yes I would like a San Tan Brewery IPA, a Hop Shock.  The waiter was down right rude in his response, we don't serve that.  I was very surprised since I had been to the phoenix city grille's website prior to my visit and THE reason I decided to go there was because the phoenix city gille's website said that they served San Tan Brewery beer.  When I informed the waiter of this he became down right rude to me.  "Well you must have been looking at an old menu online" he barked.  Wow, I was looking at what phoenix city grille had on their website, if that was wrong it was not my fault.  I ordered another beer and moved on.  At that point the rude waiter disappeared... as in I never saw him again.  After 30 more minutes another waiter came by and asked if I would like to order food.  Yes, I have been waiting to order your carne asada street tacos I responded.    When the tacos came out the presentation was very good.  Two tacos, a red and a green sauce and a cabbage/tomato garnish.  The green sauce was very good, I believe it was a tomatillo based sauce which is not something I find everyday.  The red sauce was very bland and lacked flavor.  As for the tacos, I was hoping for a little more flavor in the the meat.  It was dry and only medium flavorful.  And then I hit a huge chunk of gristle and had to spite it out.  At that moment the second waiter came back to ask if I wanted to order another beer.  Having had enough of the crappy 4 peaks brewery offering for an IPA, I said yes I'll have a glass of your house Zinfandel.   The waiter then went over to the bar, pulled out a bottle of 7 deadly Zins and poured the remaining half glass.  He then shuffled and shuffled around and came out with a different Zinfandel label and poured the other half glass.  The wine was fine but I've never seen a waiter pour half a glass of one label and half a glass of another label.  Moving my focus back to the tacos, I then I hit it.  A large shard of bone in my second taco.  At that point, interesting conversations aside, I just wanted to get out of there.  As I walked out I noticed that the restaurant that had been packed during happy hour was 3/4 empty for dinner service.  The staff was too busy and too rude to serve me during happy hour and then at 8pm there was no one there wanting their crappy service.

zG1CPrN1R5AyAdaezMK5wQ.text: Great food, outstanding service! Nicholas has been one of the best servers we've had anywhere. He was extremely helpful and his recommendations were perfect. I would definitely recommend Phoenix City Grille. And I don't think you could order a bad thing on the menu. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Qa8KUPgnHRJinjZGWLZeUQ.text: food average. Ambience lacking.  Kind of pricey.

laQ0MfGMfKHeW8lgJGCwkQ.text: Service was competent, polite and accommodating. Short ribs were good, though not perfect (but I am admittedly picky about braised meats). Shoestring fries - a substitution provided without complaint - are not my favorite style, but here they were hot, crispy and delicious.  And to top it all a good local beer selection.

Koy181vqecAkOx0_6X4WkQ.text: I had my birthday dinner here tonight with the family and it was fairly good. I got there 30 minutes early and decided to have a happy hour drink at the bar. Well.... their definition of well drink is a little different than most places, for example, they do not offer a well margarita.....pretty odd. The bartender was terse and I did not care for him. Anyway, as my family arrived we decided to sit down. We had made a reservation through open table and they accommodated our party of 12, so that is a positive. The food was good, not amazing, but solid. My family is big into sharing so I got to try the beef tenderloin (good and came with a tasty chipotle potato), the chicken special (chicken with green chile and really good goat cheese polenta), the pork tenderloin (this was maybe the best thing, it had a really flavorful sauce and horseradish mashed potatoes), and the ribs (flavorful, but a little drier than I prefer). We also split Caesar salads which were tasty, they had very well seasoned croutons. The service was good considering our large party size and it was an enjoyable place to have a large party.   I kind of think of it in terms of a wedding....a lot of wedding food isn't amazing but it works because it works for big groups....I think this place is like that. I probably wouldn't go here for a date, but I would come here with a big group again.

kw4-XLwL9s4wlfZ67uYN1g.text: Went in for Happy Hour. Food was good. Bartender was rude as could be. Curt, snarky, and a short pour on the wine. Clearly annoyed when we had a question about our bill. Shrimp was tasty, thank goodness.

ywlhW8IdHFnaVgMYOJP7Xg.text: A friend and I visited this place while I was visting her in Phoenix. Not many outsiders know about it since it since it is a little tucked away in a run down mall, but she, being a local, was quite clued in. I was a little apprehensive at first, but once we stepped inside the atmosphere was good overall. It has subdued lighting and music played in the background but never too loud.   The food portions were good and the pot roast I tried was decent. Also worth mentioning is the bread pudding which seems to be a favourite. It was a decent meal, definitely wouldn't call it outstanding.   One good thing about this food was that it was well priced - that's always useful.

Csf6giHjvav5iz4U_7HWrw.text: My Husband and I stopped in for a few drinks and apps. I literally can't stop thinking about the Machaca. Super friendly bar staff and if their dinner menu is anything like the appetizers we tried... I'm afraid we might become PCG addicts. Will be back for sure!!

DMDNG-nifLDGQBrKgQQU1g.text: This is one of my favorite spots in town! Just great home cooking. The Buttermilk pie is to Die For! This is a Phoenix must!

6CZOVCJZfkbvXMK73VbS9Q.text: Great Customer Service, one of the reasons to go back. Food is very delicious, and the desserts are amazing. Great place for a date night out.

5gjhxm9jjNbQJpgUQezokw.text: First time customer and I found the place average at best. Food was okay, service okay...everything was just okay. Did I leave thinking I can't wait to go back? Nope. 55+ age group.

Mwf7O5J_a5axK2lsUAsb6g.text: Nice place, love that it is non-chain and locally owned.  My dish was a layered chicken enchilada. It was delicious. I am dinging a star because it was barely tepid. I like my hot food hot! I was with a small group and did not want to make a fuss by sending it back. Love the decor and menu and will definitely give it another whirl. The service was excellent.

cISZW71HsBw4ZEjyns6NSQ.text: This restaurant really does it right!  Really good food and great service!  We started with the Beet Salad and just had to try a small Tomato Soup, both of which were absolutely delicious!  We also split the Hummus, which was probably one of the best hummus dips I've ever had.  Then we shared the Crispy Eggplant Sandwich and it did not disappoint one bit.      We totally enjoyed our whole experience at Phoenix City Grille.  The service couldn't have been any better.  The gal was very attentive, friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend this restaurant and I can't wait to return to try other items on their menu.

tzrJM5akIpY4zzBlqLpCiA.text: Another trip out of town and Yelpers haven't let me down yet!  Came here on advice of Yelp. Great cozy ambiance, great lighting, interesting menu with lots of variety whether you want a salad, burger, pasta, or steak.  Also a good wine list - not too long, and some interesting varietals.    The 4 of us enjoyed: black bean soup, black and bleu burger, ribs, salads, and meat skewer appetizers. As first time guests, we were offered a free dessert- we happily chose the chocolate torte with vanilla gelato.  Food was great, service was friendly and competent, and the place was pretty much full by the time we left @ 6:45 pm on a Thursday (we stopped in for an early bite after a Spring Training game nearby). I would be a regular if I lived here!  I'll definitely be back next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The black bean soup - delicious!

j0_CsZ9Mw37g1_hgbutZ7Q.text: My favorite place in Phoenix. Love the small plates, especially the corn cakes.  Service and ambiance are excellent.  Always get the chocolate tort!   Yum.

5XU74er9Epw4FOzPTnP0iA.text: I just have to add that the owners here really know the definition of good customer service. A month ago, I took out-of-town guests for Sunday brunch. Part of the reason I chose City Grille was because they had a promotion where you could get a free appetizer for checking in on a Smart phone. All you had to do was show your server. Well, my server, no matter how nicely I approached the matter, kept insisting that deal was only for people who brought a print-out of an email--even after I showed her on my phone what their own restaurant's Facebook page stated! She just shrugged and said "Well nobody explained it to me." I don't fault her if nobody told her. But I do fault her for not even bothering to say anything like, "I don't know anything about that but let me go check with a manager" after I showed proof. It wasn't even the appetizer but the principle of the matter.  I left a comment on the restaurant's Facebook page--very diplomatic, not with any self-entitled overtones. Their social media person asked me to email him directly outlining what happened. Less than two days later, he wrote me, with the owner copied in, apologizing and offering to send me a gift certificate for dinner for two!   This update is not to say "Woohoo! I got a free meal." It's just an appreciation for when a restaurant is willing to own up to a mistake and try to make up for it. It also sounds like because of me, they will remember to make sure all servers are aware of promotions like that. And when I did go back for my free meal, that same server was there, lol. Luckily I had another server who was a lot warmer and approachable.

WlpkDp62Rv-4wQL2dGVNtA.text: This is a really pleasant place to enjoy a quiet 'home-cooked' meal.   I love the fact that they support our local breweries!   I was very happy with my choice, the PCG pasta. The pasta was not drowning in sauce, so the flavors of the vegetables served with the pasta really added to the dish. The chicken was delightful..savory and juicy.  My friend ordered the short rib which was just incredible. The Cabernet-smoked bacon sauce really seals the deal on this dish!   I'll be back..

UqbIkQRBNFytW7nBf0Dv9Q.text: Phoenix City Grille knocked my socks off with some special treats they dazzled us with at a CMYE (Community Manager Yelp Event) and I recently returned with the generous buy-one-get-one voucher they sent us home with (it expires on the 30th, fellow Yelpers who haven't redeemed theirs yet).   After the delicious scallops at our Yelp event, you can guess what I had my heart set on -- hopeful that there would be a special, since they are not a regular menu offering.   Fortunately for me, there was a short rib and scallop special. It was accompanied by fried green beans. The sort rib was good. Definitely tender with a real hearty, rich, beefy flavor. There was only 1 scallop. It was a little tougher than the ones showcased at our event.   Trying to minimize the calories, I asked for plain green beans instead. The kitchen sent out the fried which our server quickly noted and corrected, leaving the fried ones for my dinner partner to enjoy. Lacking any substantive willpower, I nibbled one or two and they were quite tasty. A light tempura coating combined with the cooking technique offered a unique, enjoyable flavor.   My "plain" green beans were dressed in olive oil with garlic, salt and pepper (just like I make at home). Still crisp, they were delicious!   So, I got my wish with the special, but the the regular menu challenges decision-making abilities with so many great options!   My friend got the beef tenderloin and it was, quite possibly, the best steak I've had in the Valley. It was fabulously tender (even cooked medium well) and perfectly seasoned. I look forward to ordering one for myself on a future visit.   I had heard about the bread pudding from the CMYE reviews and so we splurged with dessert. It was phenomenal! Think the fluffiest, most custardy french toast flavor you've ever had! Thank goodness it was cut into two pieces -- better for a peaceful sharing.   Another tip from the CMYE, thanks to Don S., I tried the Brophy Clark Pinot Noir ($11/glass) and it was love at first sip! I liked it so much, I called Total Wine to see about buying a bottle for home and searched the vineyard's website for where to buy a bottle in Arizona but didn't get very far. I guess I'll have to add that to the reasons to return to Phoenix City Grille!

ySPGVqBU79hwUMOwXG3Qqw.text: Great place for a work lunch! There weren't a ton of vegetarian options but the ones I tried (appetizer and entree) were both excellent and I'd happily eat again. Like many other Yelpers recommend, the crispy eggplant appetizer is really really good. Perfect balance of textures and a really great combination of flavors. I also had the season vegetable plate which contained a variety of roasted vegetables like cauliflower, carrot, and potatoe served with a lemony aioli which was perfect and spring-like. On another visit I got the crispy eggplant sandwich, which is like the appetizer but super sized and served between two delicious brioche buns. Both entrees are fantastic! Service was great and the space is nicely lit with a lot of natural light. It's just a little bit on the pricey side.

_Vlv-NOwP8y-kr3k9gAD3A.text: Finally went here after attending the CMYE and had a great meal! PCG is a very classy little restaurant that is low-lit and practically perfect for dinner, vino and conversation. The staff is very professional and helpful, and it was undoubtedly a pleasure to be served by them.  The food was good, though a bit steep in the pricing department. I tried their famous corn cakes, and I also got to try the 16th Street Pot Roast and Rose Lane Chicken. The corn cake was the highlight of the meal for me. Imagine the flavor of corn bread (that's not dry, mind you) accompanied with chicken, salsa, black beans, and topped with some jack cheese. Mmm! Every flavor really complimented each other really well. That appetizer was what a fancy southwestern appetizer should be like. The pot roast was also delicious, and I would say the same about the chicken. The meat in both dishes was cooked just right, flaky and tender for the roast, and perfectly juicy (not wet, but not dry) for the chicken. Both entrees were very comfort food-ish.  I hope to eat at PCG again sometime soon. The food and service were great and it definitely has a great ambiance about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot roast
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn cakes

_F9J7BtH_I4L6sUs3GmlOQ.text: I've been here a number of times. They're good for lunch, dinner or drinks after work.  Food is always solid. Service can be hit and miss. I like that they have seasonal daily specials. Today I had the "catch of the day", halibut with polenta and green chili sauce. The fish needed a little something to take it to that next level. More sauce or seasoning... Good portion for lunch. I didn't feel like a nap was necessary to make it through the afternoon.  Bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer is fantastic!!!

TI5DGbRlXZFIwwR4rvPMqQ.text: I've been going here since it opened. The menu has changed over the years, but the quality of food has not.   I had the braised short rib for dinner. My wife had the pollo asado. Both were delicious. I've never seen pollo asado served on the bone, but it was a nice surprise.   The restaurant only has about 20 tables, so it can be crowded, especially for large groups, but well worth any wait you have.

wlfq51rJzOPd-LjmUlnuXA.text: we live close and have gone there many times. Most recent trip , seated quickly and ordered . waited on promptly. we got the cornbread right away as asked for. we just chitty chatted and didn't pay attention to the wait. The waitress came and said the chef screwed up my sandwich and had to re do...so our food was complimentary..I thought just mine was...but when she came at end of meal she said everything was complimentary. Now that's what I call good service and concern for he customer and doing it right. I said wow..it is my birthday (which it was) so that was a pleasant surprise. She also offered free dessert but we were full and thought that would be greedy.  So will still have a positive view of this foodery and will continue to go back....their standards are high.

ZY4fTTAkdw3ru_jejxXZSw.text: My bf and I headed here last Friday night after we decided some normal, comfort food was in order after scoping out a few other trendy places downtown on Yelp.  While I typically don't like restaurants located in a strip mall, this location didn't seem to 'mallish' and there was ample parking. We arrived around 8:30pm and the place seemed pretty busy with an older crowd. I think we were probably the youngest people in there. Old people know where good food is :) The patio seating might get a bit old with people walking in-between tables so we opted for something inside.  The atmosphere was dark but yet inviting. We were greeted by a smiling hostest and seated as soon as we walked in. Our waitress came around quickly and gave us water and we had just the right amount of time to decide we would try the Crispy Eggplant bites for an appetizer and Baby Back ribs for me with a twice baked potato rather than fries and my bf's Grilled Pork Tenderloin.   Having never had fried eggplant I envisioned almost chip like wedges of eggplant but these were more like patties. And OMG were they good! There were only 3 and we definitely fought over the last one and savored every bite!  I'm not usually a girl who orders ribs but these were definitely good. The sauce was unique, a little smokey but not too much but they had really good flavor. The coleslaw was really good, reminded me of KFC with a small punch of ginger and the twice baked potato put a smile on my face. Totally not on the diet but I didn't care. My bf was really happy with his pork tenderloin and the small piece I had was really good. He continued to comment throughout the meal how good it was so I know he liked it a lot.  To further ruin my diet, we ordered the warm chocolate torte. It was good but one of those really strong, flour-less bunt cakes and they usually aren't my favorite.  Overall, between the atmosphere, food and service, this is definitely a place we will come back to!

97ZwPH6PgT2VJkF9_F6Z4Q.text: Unfortunately we had very poor service for lunch one day. The foods was very good, I had the lunch special salad. Lunch for two people took over 90 minutes and it took 15 minutes to get our drinks. The location is easy to get in and out of, there was plenty of parking, the ambiance was relaxing and the place was very clean. I hope to come back and be able to write a better review.

omRdPK6kdDzu_-qqZhVMzw.text: On west side of street. Turn in 1 st entrance.  It is a one way driveway in front of the building. If u turn in 2nd entrance there is no way to get back around. Macha stuffed green chile tacos! OMG...  Hummus plate is the best!  BBQ ribs pretty tasty... skewers are not bad either...  GC tacos and Hummus are my picks!  Had these things on  happy hour...  nice place, good service, good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Machaca beef chile  OMG delicious!
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon &amp; lemon skewer.  Very good!
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pcg hummus   delicious!

XOCq6Yv8_xdK8RcNNEtqNA.text: I've driven by this place so many times over the last (almost) 20 years, and finally decided to check it out. The atmosphere is very inviting, with a warm, casual, neighborhood vibe. The service was wonderful, especially our server, Rhyne. We started out with the green chile pork appetizer to share, and both agreed it was tremendous. Apparently it's only been on the menu for a few months. It's a real winner, and was nicely plated, too. The flour tortillas, fresh and thick with a little char, were stars in and of themselves. For our main entrees, my boyfriend had the 5 chile spiced chicken breast sandwich with the "simple" side salad and sherry vinaigrette. Simple it was not; it featured a lovely array of ingredients on mixed greens. Most restaurants consider a side salad an afterthought and don't put much effort into it. Not Phoenix City Grille! Even the dressing was outstanding. He thoroughly enjoyed his sandwich too, remarking that it was expertly seasoned. I ordered the salmon skewers appetizer as my entree, and they came with a nice arugula salad with roasted beets. The salmon was perfectly seasoned and cooked, and the salad complemented the salmon beautifully. For dessert, we shared the pumpkin cheesecake - it's Fall, after all! - and it was a lovely ending to a truly enjoyable dining experience.  Phoenix is really becoming a dining destination, with trendy new (and increasingly pricy) restaurants popping up all over the place. Phoenix City Grille offers fresh, tasty, and interesting food at a very reasonable price, and without pretensions by either staff or clientele.

qZFipenuA9hVX_OqhicCFw.text: As one of our favorite restaurants, PCG was an easy choice for our wedding rehearsal dinner. Sheldon helped us plan a wonderful dinner and the room was perfect for our group. PCG printed a special menu for our guests and everyone was delighted by the food, ambience and service. You can't go wrong with this restaurant.

Cvh0xJwsFTvD1nh6MeNRrA.text: L O V E  Phx City.  This place is amazing!  Of the five million times I have been here, I have yet to actually go for Happy Hour, which I hear is equally amazing.  I love that this place is nice enough to warrant going to for a special occasion, but neighborhood enough that you will usually run into at least one person you know every time you come.  The Rose Lane Chicken makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  The Bread Pudding is divine, and they get mucho brownie points for not putting raisins in it!!  (I am super not into raisins)  They have a well rounded wine list, which was my go to, until the day I tried the Pomegranate Mango Collins.  Hellllooooo drink love!  Sweet and tart, but not too much of either, this drink is awesome!  Many awesome things on the menu, great daily specials, & you can really taste the love and local difference in all of their menu items.  The service is 97% awesome, very seldom do I get slow service there & it has never been slow enough to irritate me.  Definitely a go to place!

I4t6pTWfiDaM3nEalvJGhw.text: Had dinner here yesterday (a Sunday) for my 31st birthday.  Spoke with Sheldon beforehand to reserve the private dining room for "20-25" people.  After some hesitation on his part, he agreed to not requiring a set menu, and I agreed that my party would be patient with the service (which did not end up being a problem at all).  He also did not require a deposit, which was fantastic.  I got there later than I wanted to, as I wanted to arrive a little before my reservation, but I got there exactly at 7:00 p.m.  After saying hello to some friends who had already arrived and were waiting in the bar, our table in the private dining room was ready after just a few moments.  We went in and began sitting down - the private dining room is off to the side of the restaurant (beyond the bar area) and was great for our party of 20.  There is a men's and women's restroom at the end of the dining room which was great as well, and the tables were organized well enough that it felt like we were eating at a single grand dining table.  Service was very good, especially considering the amount of people we had and that they were willing to do separate checks.  After getting our drinks ordered and delivered (which took about half an hour), we ordered.   For appetizers, the table had the hummus, but a few others ordered the green chile queso (very unique and good), the fried eggplant bites (I was hesitant about the goat cheese as I'm not a big fan, but there is not that much and it just enhance the flavors of the whole dish, which was good), and the bacon-wrapped shrimp (YUM).  All of it was good.  Personally, I also had a cup of the black bean soup (very good, especially if you cannot get enough black beans like myself).  My entree was the surf n' turf pasta, which was really flavorful.  You get two shrimps, which were decent sized, and two medallions of beef, which were cooked well but not overdone.  The fettucine was not al dente but still had a good texture, and the sauce was not buttery/overwhelming.  Everything felt/tasted complimentary, which was a good thing!  We finished things off with their version of chocolate cake, and they had a pumpkin cheesecake which was interesting, but I would have preferred regular cheesecake.    Anyways, I wanted to thank the staff here for a great birthday dinner.  Everything tasted great, the service was good and prompt (I don't believe there was a single issue, which is amazing considering they had 20 people all ordering something totally different, without a set menu), and we all had a great time.  We got started a little after 7:00, and we were done a little before 9:40 (from what I can remember).  For 20 people all ordering drinks and food, that was some efficient service!  I would definitely recommend PCG for a big dining party.  They were courteous, professional, and accomodating.  Fantastic place with very good food!  Thanks!

V15SSSIUaFOuwbF63ujrhA.text: We found the Phoenix City Grille by accident while visiting Phoenix. We were there for lunch and the food exceeded our expectations. The service was very good. The next time we are in Phoenix this will be our first stop.

IUUWdpO5ZxnX5OrZ3uPGig.text: Looooove the griddled corn cakes!  The first time I came I made the mistake of ordering a salad...not that the salad wasn't good, it was just that I ended up wishing I had ordered a whole griddled corn cake for my entree instead after having a taste of it as an appetizer. The second time I came that was exactly what I did and I left very satisfied. Actually, any of their "corn" food items are delicious--try the corn bread that comes with the soup--also absolutely amazing!  I tend to find everything else I've tried a bit too salty or oily to my taste (for example, the bacon wrapped shrimp and the crispy eggplant sandwich), but seriously, the corn bread and cake makes up for it alllll.

OcAa1f7LHk2DgCMVacoNSg.text: Wow! What a great night of good food and FANTASTIC service. Sheldon introduced himself despite his busy kitchen and full dining room. Our waiter was right on time, was confident in the menu and gave a generous pour. My beautiful plate of Idaho trout w/roasted cauliflower tasted perfect. Her plate of cedar plank salmon and fingerling potatoes was excellent. The fish was perfectly prepared, but I'm coming back for the veggies! Oh, they have a plate of roasted veggies on the menu too. Finally, it was a real treat to chat w/the chef about the upcoming Devour event. We are coming back soon!

BgeFCOeg7XH1EeUD3qb2Mw.text: I went to add this to my newly made list of favorite brunch spots and couldn't believe my eyes.. I hadn't reviewed PCG yet!?!  If someone were to ask me what my favorite brunch dish was, without batting an eye I would respond "Griddled corn cakes from PCG of course". Take corn cakes and cook them to perfection (you know with a few corn kernels stuck in there), stuff them with chicken, green chillis, jack cheese, serve them with salsa fresco, potatoes and black beans. This would also probably be my last meal on earth if I had a choice.  You feeling my taste buds? It honestly doesn't get any better.   Outside of brunch, the food here is amazing.  The Rose Lane Chicken, The Surf and Turf, any of the fish dishes.. Everything is made with quality ingredients nothing fancy and full of flavor. They do it right. I held my college graduation dinner here it is that good. I would recommend this to the pickiest of eaters, and it is great for groups.

a5hIzjvvOxewlA3ZOPGIzg.text: Wonderful food, Shrimp, Short Ribs, served by a truly attentive wait staff in a cozy warm environment.  We be back and soon.

0rLMJrzVFfZOx00KmOmEqA.text: I don't know why we waited so long to go back to Phoenix City Grill!! It's been close to 2 yrs and we really liked it the first time we were there. It's even better than we remembered!!!   I tried the mandarin mule drink and loved it. very refreshing!!! The green chile queso was yummy!!! Hubby had a chicken dish and I had the short rib special. Um...we will be back!!!!!

L9CMJ-z-PIrzs8P8w6kX0w.text: Easily one of my favorite 3-course meals that I have had in Arizona. We started off with the Eggplant Bites which were creamy, crunchy, sweet, bitter, and just absolutely delectable. I followed it up with the Cedar Plank Salmon which is literally served on a plank of cedar (duh), and it was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Normally too much horseradish (part of the puree on the salmon) can overpower a dish, but PCG had that seasoning on fleek. Lastly, came the Warm Chocolate Torte; goodness gracious what a topper to a meal!   The service was also fantastic! We were seated right away and the server was very knowledgeable about the menu. I look forward to trying more items on the menu next time we visit!

JLa2TowsTfWNPwgqkzupQw.text: First time here for our anniversary and food was amazing. Service was great. My husband and I had tonight special and it was amazing. Definitely going back. If anyone want a nice, romantic place to go have dinner this is the place to go.
