WaGW3vxY0nKivMumQmBakw.text: Love this place!! It's a great local restaurant and the vibe is warm and inviting.  My fiance and i like to eat at the bar and it is always busy!! My fave items to order are the shrimp appetizer and the Cedar plank salmon. Both are amazing. Great Pinot noirs too!!! Highly recommend and you can't go wrong.

fBJzWPX4UhOx_UHUZ9jvpQ.text: I work in San Francisco at a tech company. I was bringing my team to Phoenix to sit down with a handful of our users there and essentially conduct casual focus groups over 2 days.  I was looking for somewhere in central Phoenix with a family vibe and a private room - Phoenix City Grille offered all of those things!  We fed 80 people across two nights and all of it was able to be planned from San Francisco. Shout out to Brittnee for going above and beyond.  The staff were courteous, quick, attentive, and very receptive to my asks  when I wanted to make changes to the menu or the format for each 'round' of guests. Not only that, but they didn't seem overwhelmed at all, even when we had a LOT of earlybirds show up and wait around.  If I could give more than 5 stars I would, if/when we come back to Phoenix I know where we'll go!

aNfJaeOzhcOQ3qiYsI4pIw.text: Leave your signature dishes alone please! We were recently in and Rose lane chicken is now trying to be something its not. We wanted family we brought in to try it because its always been a favorite. Now not so much.  The changes do not go together.  Appreciate trying to be more modern, but in this case , it doesn't work. If you have good things going for as long as you have been in business , and doing very well... leave good things alone! Try totally different things , but leave long running items the way they are good and done well for years.  Came to find out the ribs have changed on the appetizer menu, which was fine, but then the cornbread is gone! There are even pictures o here of it that people are reviewing  the ribs..  Opinion of customers that love PCG here.

ePjNOTX_ya0fSzSQAU5OmQ.text: I really like this restaurant. The food is great and they have some unique items on the menu too.  The ambiance is very pleasant and I LOVE the fact that even when the place is slammed (as it was on St. Paddy's day) you can still hear the other people at your table when they're speaking. I hate it when you have to shout at each other to be heard. This is one of my favorite places to eat in the North Central-ish area!

7KieZ6vz4cJxKZOt9ME6vw.text: Excellent food and service at fair prices. Great fine dining atmosphere. Family owned business that clearly prides themselves on providing quality entrees. Love this place and recommend for special occasion or just a great evening out.

j2IEniZMjjifc0WJivKtqw.text: This place is really exceptional. Our party of 6 was seated comfortably and (more or less) promptly on a bustling Saturday night. The food was reasonably priced and excellent. I had a Sea Bass over risotto ( a special) which was exceptional, not what you would expect for seafood in Arizona. My wife had beef short ribs (one of their specialities )also excellent. Our server was beyond good as were several of her colleagues.  Most importantly, this is clearly a well run restaurant. A wonderful evening and a comfortable price. What more can I say ?

K_m-t0WDnIGtkKLmmaNZ5w.text: OK, my last review was in 2012 so you know I have been coming here for years. In all the years I have been a customer, I have never had a bad meal or poor service. This place is truly exceptional. You can order an appetizer if you are not hungry. They have sandwiches, salads, pasta, the best burger ever along with steaks and ribs. I have had almost everything on the menu and I love it all. If you love brunch, they have one to order off the menu on Saturday and Sunday. SOOOO good. The servers are all the best and the owner is always there, I think that is the reason for the success. They take reservations and can handle large groups. I drive from Scottsdale it is that good. Try it, you'll like it.

t7imLwKO3T-svRGkp1bddQ.text: Good location and in walking distance of other bars and restaurants. Service was excellent. For the price of the food I was expecting excellent food. It was a Saturday midday type time, so it was not too crowded. I had the burger, which was dry and flavor was not there. My friends said their food was ok, so edible. Not a place I would eat again until I know for sure the chef knows how to make a simple burger.

oFMS_vis9pwS8I8r2YuP5w.text: Phoenix city grill is so good. My grandma loves coming here everyday and she is picky eater. I like to get the hamburger with Mac and cheese. It's very good. I would definitely recommend it.

A3xzV7xe531Tq0C6c-6ZDQ.text: On the evening of December 21 I joined St. Mary's Basilica for a staff Christmas party it was my first visit to your fine restaurant everything's perfectly fine perfectly delicious what a great Manhattan cocktail and Kudos especially to Jake and Tiffany for great service... Let me make sure to mention it was some of best food I've ever had in Phoenix... I'll be returning soon!

DQPaxjWJ_R-VymwOYbiGgw.text: This is an awesome restaurant! Service is outstanding and their happy hour while very busy (we all know a good deal) didn't leave anyone waiting. My favorite items are the eggplant appetizer and the green chili pork. Max was our server and for the number of tables he had to attend to--he rocked! We never waited for a drink or our food. He was fun and personable. We WILL BE BACK!! Awesome neighborhood spot!

hGiYFkYR_tNBxOEUMjv1pw.text: This is the second time I've been to PCG, first was with a friend visiting from out of town, this time w/ family. We came thru the back entrance which was a little surprising walking thru the kitchen. The good news, there's lot of extra parking in the back. We were all hungry. I had the shrimp appetizer & brussel sprouts, Bebe had the root vegetable plate & skewer of salmon. Sweetie ordered the green chili burger & tortilla soup. The food was very good, at one point we were all too busy eating to talk. But to be honest, the stuffed Shrimp was overcooked, it was still good but it wasn't great. The bacon wrap was a bit too chewy. The burger was dry too. Even with the green chili the meat was just too dry. But the good news the other items were spot on. The Brussel sprouts were so delicious with pancetta, marcona almonds, parsnip & leek puree a with basil chimchurri!! The root vegetables, salmon skewer & tortilla soup were great too! We didn't have room for dessert but they sounded good. We'll be back!

XgnTacXJUuXTnaymC55yKg.text: I met a colleague here for lunch, he said that this is one of his favorite restaurants in Phoenix. The place is located in a strip mall and it has a cute small outdoor seating area. It's a pretty dark restaurant to be careful when you take the two steps up to the dining area.   Service is very good and place is very clean.  I ordered the following: Roasted Beet Salad ($10): it had mixed greens, candied pecans, orange segments, goat cheese, roasted beets, apples and sherry vinaigrette.  It was very good, very light and flavorful and the dressing was perfect.  Dreamy Draw Chili ($6): I love chili and unfortunately I'm not a fan of this one.  It was too thick so I didn't really enjoy it.  This is the perfect place for a business meeting, next time when I'm in Phoenix and need to schedule lunch with a colleague, I will definitely go here.

Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet salad, very good

yAwjv0IdBl54S9ka6rAGbQ.text: We had a really good meal at Phoenix Grille. The ambiance was relaxed and pleasant. The waitress was charming and attentive. The eggplant bites should not be missed; they're like nothing we've had before. i had the planked salmon; it was really tender and succulent. The Rose Lane Chicken was excellent, as were the short ribs, and the filet special. The desserts were top notch, with the buttermilk pie really standing out.

KYbfSRuRHoixKq3VvzGT1g.text: Great food! Great service!! Make a reservation for sure! Eggplant sandwich was AMAZING!! As was the bread pudding dessert. We'll definitely be going back

3fMbS-W0KrpKMXDD4adhVA.text: Was there last night, and as always,  the food and service is nothing short of amazing!!

3KcFdOo97NFFfrRnTMpATA.text: Our favorite. We drive 30 minutes to have not only a great meal but for the atmosphere. Very cosmopolitan feel.

Sb8k1uSgR5AS9Rbg16BfXA.text: Have been dining at Phoenix City Grille for years......in the past they have been consistently good......something we could always count on Last night was a shock....the food over all was average at best and my Rose Lane Chicken was was awful.....so disappointing  In my opinion they are in jeopardy of losing their fine reputation

oixhsjClZiiqeNok8DQrZg.text: Best place for a private event. If you are a rep looking to do a dinner training event you have to book this place. They have the private room next to the kitchen - away from the rest of the restaurant so it's fantastically quiet if you are tying to give a presentation to a small group.  No fee for the projector or screen - private bathrooms- personal server and top notch food.  They made us a personalized limited menu but they will also offer full.  Sheldon is the owner and he really set up a great facility - I travel the west looking for decent places to give small dinner presentations (8-20) and it's always too loud or the food is bad.  5 stars all the way for Phoenix city grill

wRxZPcrUELz97EKJAJ8qkQ.text: Terrific place. Hosted a dinner for a group of 8 on Christmas Eve. Food was excellent and the service was simply outstanding. Some of the best food in Phoenix in a pleasant, comfortable and accessible setting. Pork shoulder entree was not only tender and juicy but tasty and interesting. One of the other guests couldn't stop raving about the burger (I thought a questionable holiday dinner order but he loved it - was sure he was going to order Prime Rib). Everyone at the table was pleased with their food - scallops, pork shoulder, burger, pasta with chicken and cream sauce. Desserts were all tasty and big enough to share.  All around great meal and enjoyable experience. I've been here a couple times and each time we walk out talking about what a terrific place this is. Highly recommend!!

10nDafx71A7jKx4BPOrINA.text: Well I made it back, this time with coworkers. One who is pretty particular. Food was great and the service was good. Tried bread pudding for dessert and left feeling very satisfied.

ij3lrjh1G9aeismlnlUiNg.text: Met a colleague from work to give each other a New Year's Toast.  Excellent service from the greeter at the entrance, seating, and service.  Meals was simple but delicious: Corn Cakes, Bacon Burger with Blue Cheese dressing, Bread Pudding.  No rushing to order, minimal wait time for food, and no rush to push us out after dining.  Just as well as the Buttered Rum Special was being enjoyed by my colleague!! Overall every thing was excellent, heartily recommended!

BJ5Zue9SWEtnR-ya5ijT7A.text: I Loves the cool music and very clean bathrooms. The photographs on the wall are beautiful and add an interesting connection to our history.  The appetizers we ordered were fantastic. We had the Griddle cakes and the spicy Hummus appetizers ! Hamburgers: the blue cheese and the PCG burger were delicious. The beef was excellent and the sauce was great! The pot Roast with bourbon gravy was excellent. The portions were big and could easily be shared by two. The Rib eye steak was large and very delicious. We also liked the flavorful mashed potatoes.  Service was very good! I will be back soon !

tWFr0kkH2Cphy81nsD3Jnw.text: I have always enjoyed dinner with friends at Phoenix City Grille. I had never tried Happy Hour there so a friend and I decided to give it a try. We sat for almost 10 minute at bar before we were asked if we'd like a drink. The Green Chile Queso Fundido was quite tasty. We intended to order a few other items but We had to pry the bartenders to return for refills and food that we decided to leave and continue Happy Hour elsewhere. Keep you posted on our return to PCG...

XRr23HjRXWVwwl3qH2u5Tg.text: Absolutely delicious!! This great downtown Phoenix mainstay has terrific chow and incredibly attentive service. We were warmly greeted and seated, and within minutes our server was taking our drink orders. PCG has a lovely wine list and beer menu with a few tasty cocktails as well. For an appetizer we had the recommended corn cakes with chicken, queso, and beans - superb... a hint of sweet and savory. Four different diners - four different dinners between us and each one tastier than the first. Black and blu burger with bacon on a soft burger bun was good (but a bit dry.) The chicken special was fresh and light and flavorful. The Idaho trout was delicate and perfectly complemented the roasted cauliflower and asparagus. And the pork chop was a huge mass of yum! We shared the bread pudding which was probably one of the best I've ever had. This place does get crowded and I would definitely recommend a reservation.  YUM.

ruxuqTCD6t7jIIGugG_1SA.text: I keep giving this place a shot because it's in my neighborhood but honestly. It just isn't worth it. The service is what gets me. I can never flag someone down to place an order. I always leave and go to either Luci's or The garage across the street and three years straight I have gotten spectacular service there.

_NNmstpQuZeDdndr5DDwjw.text: Stoped here for dinner.  Our waitess was not bad but not the greatest. I think she wad having a bad day. The food was very good. I would recommend  this place you won't  be disappointed.

nFKQ2_p_O6aHtjkAKxDdhg.text: First of all...we were a group of 17-18 women. Our ONE waitress was able to keep on top of all our requests.  Natalie is AMAZING!  I started off with the Maple Glazed Candied Bacon cinnamon roll. A very tasty treat. It's a must try and must share. I'm so glad I shared with everybody because I wouldn't have been able to have my everso tasty Seafood Sandwich. Talk about YUM! Shrimp and Crab with scrambled eggs, asparagus and hollandaise sauce. They were light on the sauce which I really appreciated.   When we first pull up, from the looks of the outside and the name Grille, I thought I was overdressed. Walking in told me I was glad I dressed a little nicer than I normally would. The inside and atmosphere was perfect for a Sunday afternoon brunch with the girls.  I have to end with our waitress, Natalie, again. Awesome! I asked her to choose a dessert for me because I couldn't decide. She brought back the luscious Croissant Bread Pudding. Buttery and carmely. Rich and another one to share! She was right on with that one!  Definitely give this place a try!

OjnGgu66KRWXI__VQLidaw.text: This is one of my favorite local restaurants and I always enjoy the food and service.  Their menu is terrific and has a number of great options although I find myself often ordering the Griddled Corn cakes (with bacon) for brunch or the 16th St beef short rib.      While I have never used them it appears they have some private space for larger group gatherings and the bar area is great and has a few TV's.    The service is always adequate to great and it is nice to have a restaurant that tends to have a relaxed atmosphere and is generally on the quieter side.  This is generally one of the restaurants I will take friends and family to when they are visiting as it tends to please a broad range of personalities and palettes.

HCk0HI1_n81MWedbi1yYFg.text: Dinner here last night was great. The steak medallions were so tender, horseradish mashed potatoes excellent! My husband loved his pcg pasta. Really good food.

nzTJ8tthMhYIW2v99WenKg.text: We just had a small group dinner in their private room and once again they did outstanding! The food was great, the service was top notch and the private room was perfect. We do many private group dinners, usually at the chain steakhouses ( Flemings, Maestros etc) but this place beats them hands down.

g_OwniXHtFJAyUu4SOtY_A.text: had the beet salad it was was good but for the price to small considering it should be a meal had half of my wife's burger now that was really good cook perfect and juicy as hell down side the service was very slow had to ask for water all time and that was from other servers because ours was never around but will be back at least for one of the Burger's

7o3uuehlgbhJebM5HryKCA.text: Went there the other night for dinner.    I had the special of the evening, seafood linguine with shrimp and crab and lemon capers butter sauce, .   WOW!!   It was great.  In fact, beyond great.    I was trying to figure out how the pasta was flavored with every bite I put in my mouth.  I think I shall call the restaurant and find out.    It was the right mix of ingredients, not too buttery, which would make it oily/greasy.   The right amount of capers, which, if there's too many, overpowers the other flavors, and the right mix of barely knowing it also contained lemon.     Oh, yes, he had the Grilled Beef Tenderloin.    Since he is on a "low carb" diet, he asked to exchange the starch for veggies.    I was thinking about having that, but I am more of a seafood, chicken gal versus beef.    I tried it.   It was good, the beef was very tender.    Sorry, can't give a review from  just one bite.   My wine was the cab, Sebastiani, Sonoma Black Cherry.    No, I don't follow the white with the seafood/chicken "rule."     I like cabs.    It was good.    I shall go back, you can count on it.    I sure would like to have the flavoring mix of the pasta.   I had called the restaurant to find out the name of my dish since it was the special of the night.    I was told it used to be on the menu, and they try to mix it up.    My opinion?     I think it should go back on the menu.    It was delish!!

l_00bJfzaOXo5VJhR4EO5w.text: This is a local joint for me, and my wife and I have been here many times. We drive by all the time and they always look busy (parking is not the easiest). But we went in last night and WOW - AMAZEBALLS! Was really good, ambience is great, staff top notch and attentive - just the way I like it. We started with the eggplant arugula and goat cheese appetizer. Sounds disgusting, I know, but WOW - delicious. Also had the steak tacos, which were really good with two different sauces to choose from. Add a glass of the house Syrah and wowza!~ We also got the Cowboy steak (mostly to take home for steak tacos in the morning) and another home run. At the end of the day, we looked at each other and said "WHY DON WE COME HERE MORE OFTEN". So, with that being said, we are going to be there more often. This place is right up there with Hillstone for me (which as some of you might know), is my #1 Arizona hangout. One recommendation would be to beef up you Pinot selection. That seemed to be lacking, and didn't love the ones that were available after sampling those. Go there are try this place, I don't think you will regret it. Tell them Attorney Steve sent you! Hahahaha Have fun, and find your sizzle! Attorney Steve, the business and real estate lawyer. attorneysteve.net

BQwlFb9u15RYlJQ6lquO8A.text: Interesting little place.  Kind of an older crowd.  I swear our bartender/waiter was Larry from Three's Company.  Still dressed like him!  The food was OK.  Have had better, have had worse.  I had the full slab of baby back ribs.  To fit on the plate they had cut the full slab into two.  Hmmm, I think one of the pieces was from an older, drier slab they were just trying to get rid of.  Not cool.  One half was juicy, succulent and perfect, the other was dry and almost inedible.  My wife had the cedar plank salmon.  Had some kind of weird mustard crust on top.  I didn't like it at all.  She found it mediocre.  It is a cute, comfy, local place with a laid back vibe.  I can certainly see us going back there again.

VL7RnUXgAyRULDokEGWJfw.text: The food is amazing! I love everything on their menu, especially their eggplant bites, tacos, and their new flank steak!! The service is fantastic as well! I love the feel of this local spot! Any time I'm in the Central Phoenix area I must stop here! See you soon PCG!

DpPCaK4g-Subqhb3EhygfQ.text: More like 2.5 stars....  I recently went here for a business lunch and had been wanting to try PCG for years as I have heard great things about it...well, I was kind of disappointed. I ordered the Green Chili Burger (green chili, jack cheese, pickled onions), I ordered the burger med rare and it was waaaay over cooked as there was no pink at all (and I didn't have time to have them cook another one as I was on my lunch hour)...The cheese wasn't even melted causing everything to slide off the burger. The green chili wasn't cooked enough as well. The bread was good but everything in-between wasn't. I had the cole slaw as my side and that was good but nothing that left an impression on me. The other business associates I was with had the Pork special, PCG pasta and the chicken sandwich. All of theirs looked good and I definitely had plate envy. I know for sure if I do go back I will not be ordering the burger but would try something different.   Service was great though!

bg1tKfa3xOFqBEdNg2VvmA.text: Been coming here for years and they never disappoint, very consistent good food and service.  My wife and I enjoy the daily specials, and they have the best burger in town.

NyG2knMggJn_em4TgElzyg.text: Thank you PCG for accommodating us and making my husband's birthday dinner perfect. Our 9 party group was full of energy, excitement and a little loud but PCG and our amazing waiter, Jarred went above and beyond to take care of us from start to finish without incident (Another place might have kicked us out ).  And on top of the amazing service, every single person LOVED their entrees and couldn't stop talking about how delicious everything was.   PCG is a hidden gem and if you haven't been make it a priority....you will not be disappointed.

JuMXxISkreJxaPwd6ZVOIA.text: We found Phoenix City Grille about 3 years ago when we were looking for a restaurant centrally located to hold a small party after son's wedding for a group of about 20 people. Phoenix City Grille (PCG) was very accommodating with us on short notice to have a table of that size and got out the food in a timely manner for us. We have visited there several times since then and have never been disappointed in the food or service. First time writing a review of our experience Saturday night, 6/8/19.   We made reservations through Open Table for 6:30 and got there around 6:20. We were promptly taken to our table and within minutes, Tara, our server, greeted us saying water was on the way and took our drink order. We got a bottle of Seven Daughters Red Blend wine, the first time we had tried that wine, but not the last time. It was good!  Tara returned shortly after with our wine, which was a twist open top, which she commented she had heard from others in the wine industry that wines without a cork often are better preserved than those with a cork. She was proficient in serving our wine and taking our order.  I got the Baja Shrimp and added a Cesar salad. Hubby got the beef tenderloin cooked medium and also added a Cesar salad. Within minutes of our order, our salads came. Delicious. Unique dressing on a Cesar salad, hubby thought it had a taste of lemon in it, but very delicious. Shortly after, our entrees came out, appealing looking, hot, and very scrumptious. Good size portions.   Tara was attentive in providing for our needs and very personable. We were in the back room with about 6-8 tables in it which about 3/4 of them were filled. It was a little loud but you could still hold a conversation without shouting at someone. Before we left, I went to the restroom which was clean.   We'll be back for sure! Its a favorite restaurant of ours here in the Valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Beef Tenderloin* (GF)
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja Shrimp (GF)

0_z8Cylk7sgBZ3BfYIqE5w.text: This solid staple of the downtown Phoenix dining scene continues to impress.  From its excellent bar staff (who make amazing libations) to its Phoenician-centered decor to its super-friendly staff, it has earned its place in the culinary and dining experience lexicon.  Truly excellent food, at truly moderate prices, served in a truly relaxing atmosphere.    I was part of a 35 person dinner reservation for a large party, so wasn't expecting "great or amazing", just hoping everything came out hot and/or cold as appropriate.  It did.  Clearly the kitchen has timing down to a science.  All of the meals were very, very good, and all of the diners enjoyed each and every course.  This is NOT easy to do!  I was impressed and will make this a regular stop whenever I am in Phoenix.  My advice - get there 30-45 minutes before dinner.  Relax in the bar - soak in the artwork. Chat with the staff.  Appreciate how far the Phoenix has risen in the last 20 years when it comes to the finer things in life.  And if its summer - well, be grateful for air conditioning!

ZGQ27Oojj0Hd84gbvwg-Jg.text: Visited here for happy hour and sat in the bar( I believe happy hour only area) 3-6 pm 7 days a week is a pleasant surprise. Bacon wrapped shrimp, Brussel Sprouts, nuts, and green chili all very good with very nice presentation. The food is the highlight here. Ambiance is good and bar and wait staff was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From the bar

KbsqEsESk7Xgl46f2PbNVw.text: I love Phoenix City Grille .  I love that they are a small family owned restaurant.  I love that they source locally.  I love that they have amazing options for the vegan / vegetarian crowd.  The healthy menu options are so flavorful and never leave you feeling like you missed out on something by eating healthy.  The summer vegetable platter I had today was one of the best meals I've had in a while.  Keep up the great work!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer vegetable platter

5rIj2sxMWQgIt2ill1eQBw.text: First time lunch meet at Phoenix City Grille. Five in our party. We had two different appetizers. Bacon wrapped shrimp was stuffed with Cotija cheese and served with a chipotle aioli and mixed green salad. Four large shrimp on plate. We had a couple of orders of eggplant bites and both apps were very good.  Two people in our party had salads,  two had sandwiches and I had the Fall Winter Roasted Vegetable Plate. I did not hear any complaints. I  am not a vegetarian. I did not have high expectations about  butternut squash with cauliflower and carrots with apples and arugula salad  but was pleasantly surprised. Exceptional taste with a carrot puree and celantro funnel chimichurri sauce. I would order that one again all day long. Service was exceptional, parking was easy. Prices are moderate but excellent quality and presentation. They offer smaller plates as an option for one or sharables.

Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Vegetable Plate

btq4gYCqGzUH2RAQlNcERw.text: My husband and I have been coming to Phoenix City Grill for many years. The food is always fresh and  delicious. The presentation is very creative. The atmosphere is welcoming. The employees are always attentive, kind and considerate. We have dear friends that live in Ahwatukee and we live near paradise valley mall. Whenever we meet for dinner, they never want us to come out there. They want to come to the Phoenix City Grill. The Phoenix City Grill is our favorite restaurant. Warmest Regards, Phil and Donna Powell.

K0saYzkrnobYUcJ_eZI4ag.text: Living so close to this restaurant, it has been on my list of places to try for a while. The location is interesting as it is on a side of a strip mall. While parking looks limited right in front of the restaurant, there is parking in the rear, so I had no trouble at all on a Sunday evening.  Our reservation was for 6:30 Sunday night and we were seated immediately at a booth when we arrived.  We were pretty hungry when we arrived so it did not take long for us to order our food. I ordered the steakhouse burger (without mushrooms) and my boyfriend ordered the Madison stir fry. I absolutely loved my burger. First of all, it was enormous and served with a good amount of thin-cut crispy fries. The burger was so flavorful. The patty was cooked to perfection (medium with a pink center). The caramelized onions added a nice sweetness, the cheese was gooey, and the house made steak sauce made the burger. In addition, the burger was served on brioche bread, which is my favorite bread for burger buns. The brioche was so soft and delicious, but the one con of brioche is how easily it falls apart. My one complaint about the dish was that the fries were not seasoned. The stir fry was also really delicious! The sriracha-citrus glaze was really unique and had just the right amount of kick. The coconut rice and quinoa pilaf meshed well with the stir fry and every flavor paired well. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back to try some of the other dishes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Madison stir fry
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steakhouse burger

oF_yxJLhLeVAUv4hYoyhtQ.text: This has been our go-to restaurant for 15 years. Food and service are consistently great! We meet here for happy hour at least one a month. Highly recommend. Especially like the griddle corn cakes.

DMvYNMunE7O4fpG7Dqy3NA.text: I knew that with 4+ stars and a ton of reviews that the PCG would not disappoint and I was spot on.    We sat at the bar and had lunch.   The bar area has bar and small high table seating.  Adjacent to the bar is a group room.   I was shocked to see 2 different Pappy VanWinkle products on the shelf (10/12 year for 30/40 a pour).   Very nice bourbon selection although I didn't partake.   Lunch was corn cake appetizer and a side of potatoes for me.  My wife had the soup and salad combo.   The corn cakes were sweet and slightly fried but turned soft quickly with pico on top.  I don't see how this is easily shareable but it was delicious.  Only change I would suggest is to move diced jalapenos into the batter.   The potatoes seemed roasted then fried and were super crunchy.   I really enjoyed them as something different than standard fries.   My wife's soup and salad were very large for a lunch portion.  A largo bowl of pinto bean chili and a Caesar salad with heirloom tomatoes for a different twist.  My wife commented that the dressing was creamy and the perfect Caesar flavor.    We washed it down with some standard wine and beer.    After we left we recommended the restaurant 3 more times in two days.  It left a great impression.   Well done PCG team!

Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soup and salad.  Chili and Caesar.

VJr-qY10lnsZimJcsOweCg.text: The service and food were absolutely amazing. Showed up on a Sunday with 12 people and had one of the most amazing experiences. By the time I remembered to take pics it was too late. So I apologize for not including more.  Cinnamon roll, where to begin, it had bacon, that should be good lol. It was pretty solid.  We had corn cakes that were awesome  I ordered a burger that was actually cooked to perfection. Can't wait to come back here again soon and hopefully for dinner this time

1zXnCXXhYosFMsQb5wTUpA.text: Their drinks, salads, and service are all great!!  It's a bit more quiet than most.. but it's a good place!! I like all the lights they hang outside:) it's very pretty.  If I want to go somewhere extremely chill, but very nice I come here:)!

NKHhLemVaa804W0f3e4T0Q.text: First of all Ryan gave my party and I great service and food recommendations. We had the bacon wrapped shrimp as a starter and it didn't disappoint. We also had the shrimp Baja and a chicken stir fry dish, we couldn't decide which was better.

genUS5f9fQgDGjnUQXQl3Q.text: This place used to be one of the better places to eat in 2002. But now it seems to have lost some of its edge.  The food has gotten consistently worse and the inside just has a level of cheese to it.  I want to like it and I will go back again (my moms favorite) but it's disappointing.   Enjoy

sJ-V7fmqQhDpJ_JE8Eqp5g.text: Horrible service! My daughter myself and two granddaughters stopped in for lunch after the rush, it took forever for us to get our food. Mind you I think there was a total of 8 people in the whole restaurant. Never any refills on our drinks and I had to ask another server for my bill. I won't be returning.

UhaxAnq4cR04-VC7tfYHHg.text: This was one of the most awkward experiences at a restaurant.  I was disappointed because I had heard nothing but good things about the restaurant.    Our waiter left the menus as the table the entire time.  We ordered both appetizers and entrees that came out at the same time.  Plus the waiter assumed we were done with the appetizers and cleared them before.    It almost felt as though they were trying to get us out as fast as possible.    The food itself was good.  The vegetable platter was good and I would order it again.  I didn't get to finish all of the vegetables because the waiter scooped it up before we were done.   I ordered the beet salad with salmon as an entree.  The beet salad was good but the salmon skewer was smaller than I hoped.    I had high expectations for the restaurant and if we had a different waiter it might have been a different experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZYdT6F5hMaETALEBvWkBGg.text: We have been going to PCG for years! The main thing we go for is the hummus platter. Too bad they decided to change this. We were there the other night and the hummus was blah. Also, no pitas. They now use bread. While the bread is delicious, it doesn't really go with hummus. Pitas go with hummus. Between all of us, we had bacon wrapped shrimp, Caesar salads and hamburgers. Honestly, none of it was great. I am not sure what has changed, or if it was a fluke, but unfortunately it will make me think twice before going back to this "go-to" place next time. :-(((

qBp0StEtO03EvlVyHSLGUg.text: Hosted a dinner presentation for our nursing organization. The room was perfect for hosting a nice dinner plus presentation. Staff was professional. Food was good. I especially enjoyed their dessert, coconut panna cotta!

s8p8xjN3M_PShmvznR1SCw.text: Thank chef Micah for a wonderful, memorable rehearsal dinner! The private Room with the patio made it a great venue for oor 40 guests from around the world.  our guests got to choose from 4 hand selected entrees after they enjoyed a wonderful custom Charcuterie tray . Everything was cooked to order, served hot and the service was amazing!  We chose this restaurant because we have eaten dinner and lunch lunch and have never been disappointed. Did I mention his Bread pudding is the best in the world!!!! Thank you again!

U-a_PRAXEVmpgF_9-sWB0A.text: Great lunch (for me) I ordered the salmon plate medium rare and my wife ordered the salmon salad.  Mine was perfect but they mistakenly cooked the salmon in her salad as medium rare.   She is not a medium rare salmon consumer.  My wife doesn't complain so I  had her salmon as well and she ate the greens.  Don't assume that everyone likes their salmon medium rare, ask.

oMGePgXN2PJ0FdbliBLexw.text: WOW! What an excellent place for a tasty lunch A friend and I were shopping in the area and this restaurant was just down the street. The fact that the parking lot was full was a good sign. It has a sort of old world ambiance inside. We split the hummus appetizer and it was SOO good! I have no idea what special ingredients they add to make their hummus, but it worked for us. It came served with a sliced pita plus veggies and drizzled with balsamic. Yum. Then came the best of all - my salad. I had the Ramona Farms Super Food Salad and it was absolutely the best I've ever had. The roasted squash was perfection. It was served with a chiltepin-dijon vinaigrette. This may mislead some, as the dressing was actually not too spicy at all and had a touch of sweetness to it. Simply divine! The grainy goodness and fruits were layered over arugula. I live in Goodyear and I swear I'm going to drive all the way back there again just for that salad! The service was top notch and not at all pretentious. The waiter gave us a great shopping tip to visit around the corner in the Melrose neighborhood. Just a wonderful experience - highly recommend!

mPqZl5Az6PbiX9WAue8McQ.text: We are visiting relatives in town and tried this place on the fly since it was conveniently located to our hotel.  What a find!   The service in the bar was outstanding and the food quality was better than what I would have expected given the happy hour pricing.   The two of us made a full dinner from 5 appetizers and even took leftovers back to our room.   We will definitely be dining here every time we come to the valley.

bBkkuAkSH48skG2f4OHo4Q.text: Absolutely delicious food.  We had our christmas company party there and they have a back room you can reserve for some privacy.  Great service, amazing food. Will return.

-YbX3t-zzF7FwMMDQiIBFQ.text: What a great place! The drinks are on the fringe of being grand. The butter beer is served hot instead of warm and the best gin they have to offfer is skol. The food is prepared very well from mesquitie grilled salmon and perfect scored grill marked steak. The polenta is superb. It was obvious the hummus was hand crafted for it contained the tell signs of a little grit. Perfectly balanced with olives and chunk of vegetables. The pita is warm and tastes of being baked in store. The bread pudding to finish it off was heavy and tasted of French toast. Unfortunately I did not taste Jack Daniel's lime whiskey in what it promised. Otherwise the server was wise and professional in our table needs. I look forward to trying the trout next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dark lighting

iVPk6HYhTZpdedzRE4w3WA.text: Unique and wonderful - classic dishes with a local flavor. Southwestern, but not "cowboy" or "Mexican"  Be sure to try the Johnny Cakes - it was much more impressive than what I was expecting

qwewL6Q67g4AQOkc74_rzA.text: My boyfriend and I dine out quite a bit but a few nights ago was our first visit. What a fantastic evening! The restaurant was beautifully dressed for the holidays and our waitress was by far, one of the evenings highlights. She was fun, attentive, personable, and her knowledge of the menu was helpful.  All this while managing a VERY difficult table with two of the most demanding women I have ever heard! She managed that situation with great ease and grace, when I KNOW she was dying inside!  The food was magnificent. The eggplant appetizer was outstanding, as was my perfectly cooked salmon.  However, the croissant bread pudding was literally the eat dessert we have had in a very long time! Creamy, warm, perfectly balanced...sublime.   We will be returning!

rhYJ0EgLifAHmBhPekUhbQ.text: Had a ceaser salad and Huge bowl of Dreamy Draw chili  comes with big wedge of cornbread for only 13$ great service and friendly staff made it a great first time visit
