Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dreamy draw chili

Htg0Yvjpt8mvcOyaFRwz3g.text: Finally made it to this spot!  So good!  Friendly staff, good happy hour, and fantastic food!  Excited to check out brunch here too!

ReEHntWIv1WssAxiav8YfQ.text: Food is on the pricier end.  Restaurants that are darker/dimmer bother me and these are one of them. I can never see my food properly but it creates a warm, romantic classy atmosphere - so this one of the places. I feel like the older folks come here but it seems like there's good happy deals at the bar on Mondays (we went on Monday).  Service is good - waiter/waitress are very attentive and they notice details. So I arrived and my other friend did not arrive but we sat down already. I told the waitress that we're waiting for one more person and waitress told me she'll come back once she arrives. The waitress sure came back quickly once she sat down!  I ordered the Pork Tenderloin - the pot roast is the most popular dish though if anyone was curious (because we inquired about it). I've slowly learned if you're in doubt about what to order you should ask what's the most popular dish and decide if it's right for you. I think pot roast can be easily made in a crock pot with Pepsi and some seasoning for the juiciness and flavor so I was ehhhh....  My pork tenderloin came with small cut pieces, mashed potatoes and vegetables. The best thing on my plate? The vegetables - they were cut small and the mixed of the vegetables were really tasty and delicious! The mashed potatoes were very buttery and the pork tenderloin was just okay - it didn't melt in my mouth and I wasn't drooling after eating it - am I suppose to? The sauce on the plate was sweet and soury and it went well with the pork tenderloin but I felt like it was overpriced.   But the rectangular plates make it seem like the food is better - it's just a deceit. I think the decor makes the food ttaste better than it really is because I think it's just simple food plated nicely (so they can charge you more).  Would I go back? Probably not.... maybe for happy hour because it seems reasonable and plus I LOVE happy hour food - I don't know why I would complain about cheap good appetizers? Well, I only complain if it's not that  great or I take a bite and I wonder why I paid for it.

T5yg-oROFUkmxXyLfFPkCA.text: Seriously....An Amazing experience! Sheldon the owner, along with the staff, just blew us away with some AWESOME FOOD! Beef short ribs 2DIE4 PLANKED CEDAR SALMON OFF THE CHARTS! and Definitely the tastiest pork chili Verdes this guys ever tasted. Don't forget desert, we shared a bread pudding whisky Carmel sauce!!!!! I'll be back!

xYiaJIJEqRR5FQ5kenib4w.text: This place has become a regular Saturday or Sunday brunch stop. The food is consistently delicious. The staff are always genuinely friendly. The drinks are strong and big.   It's usually an interesting mix of families dining out, or younger folks relaxing in the bar area.  Highly recommended...one of the best restaurants in central Phoenix.

gx8p9vf15wTDixMRXIkqrA.text: Staff and ownership is overall wonderful. If something ever goes wrong they will make it right.  Very rare do bad things happen.  Great vibe.  Great music.  Happy hour all day Monday and Tuesday

3XESibp_ZU1kvZHisy9wLQ.text: I hadn't been here in 10 years and was pleased to see it was still a great place to eat dinner. There are a lot of options on the menu, no matter what you're in the mood for. The eggplant sandwich caught my eye, and I was glad to have ordered it! The crispy eggplant with the jalapeno jelly was delicious and unique. The fries that came on the side were hot and crispy. I also ordered a red sangria and it was one of the best sangrias I've had; it was a little drier than most, which I liked. I'll be coming back to try more items on the menu!

c6JAoy1iL8hQ0TmKVxazQQ.text: I enjoyed my meal and experience at PCG.  My dinner date and I shared the chicken Enchilada appetizer, PCG pasta (small portion), and the Jack Daniels bread pudding desert.  The Enchilada appetizer was good, but unfortunately was served at room temperature and was not hot enough.  Since we ordered the appetizer, we went with the small portion of the pasta, and I wish I had chosen the large size because the small portion was as the menu said: small.  There's just no way of knowing portion size.  The PCG pasta was very good and I would order the large size.  The small size is more for elderly people.  Our server listened to our request to put the sun-dried tomatoes on the side and she provided great service.  A different employee who seated us was high on drugs or something because he wanted us to know "how happy he was feeling."  And with his facial expression and demeanor, you could see he was happy in an unusual way.  This didn't bother us as he wasn't our server.  The bread pudding desert definitely made this review go from 3 to 4 stars.  Not only was it very tasty, the portion size was huge, so that made up for the small pasta!  We were definitely wowed by this desert.  We will definitely come back.

OQjlAZshlNDOGb_uIWWGFg.text: I used to live in the area and came here frequently....and it was always phenomenal, but it has been a bit since I have been here.     This past weekend I decided to surprise my wife with an anniversary dinner here and we couldn't have been happier.  I made reservations about a week in advance and they were ready with a great table when we arrived. Our server was attentive without hovering and we never felt like we were being rushed.   PCG has many choices and everything I have had has been wonderful. Saturday we both had the special steak of the day. The steak was delicious and the red pepper potatoes even better! They have a nice wine selection and the Old Vine Zin we tried was very nice.

Iqdn-YLo1mMXmRy1ocowiw.text: WOW A fantastic night out!!!from the hostess who gladly moved us to a different table and then checked back with us to see if the table was more to our liking. Natalie was AWESOME she know  the art of serving and has mastered it Last but not least...the food was exceptional everything we ordered was fantastic. we all left big fans of this spot and are looking forward to returning!!!!!!!!!!!!

a0IY63bt9rfKA_CoTCUBfg.text: My husband and I absolutely love coming here! The food is always spot on and delicious! On our last visit, we brought our 9 month old daughter and requested a high chair. The straps on the chair were broken so we asked for a different one... And the 2nd high chair was also broken. The staff was amazing, food tasty, but would have been a perfect experience if we didn't have to worry about the baby slipping out of the high chair.

YnAu2eH8vjDOzLr7qUXvQA.text: Outstanding service and delicious food!  I was with a group of 10 women celebrating multiple birthdays. All of us were very pleased with our girls night out at Phoenix City Grill!

yf1nm5j7xQddVdi5edqaKg.text: I've been here several times and have always had a good meal.  I wanted salmon today... but I'm always reluctant to order salmon out.  Even at upscale restaurants it tends to be way too fishy for my taste.  I went out on a limb and ordered the salmon skewers over arugula and roasted beets. It honestly might have been the best salmon I've had out.  It was cooked perfectly - with no fishy taste whatsoever - melt in your mouth good.  The salad was wonderful as well.  I ate every yummy morsel.  I will definitely be back for lunch and this will be my go to.

I_K4dM_vHSpXomG4S_mGzA.text: To start of the new year, we were in Phoenix. My cousin recommended this place and he was able to make reservations via Open Table for the 6 of us. Our reservations were for 7pm, but they were that packed that we didn't get seated until around 7:30. It's a cozy lil place and when we finally did get seated we sat in the "governor's corner."  They had a lot of drink specials which I would have loved to try, but I was feeling under the weather. I ended up ordering the Cedar Planked Salmon. I made my husband get the special for the night,  ribeye surf and turf (basically shrimp, sausage and scallops on a stick as the surf part). My salmon was a slightly over cooked and I wasn't a fan of the horseradish potatoes, but I ended up trading the potatoes with my husband's potatoes which were so much better. =) He seemed like he enjoyed his meal and he ended up eating the rest of mine too. (That's what husband's are good for ;)) In any case, I loved the atmosphere and the company. We ended up getting two free desserts with the kitchen being backed up and the wait for the table. We ended up with the croissant bread pudding and the warm chocolate torte. Both were delicious, but the warm chocolate torte was my favorite.   Overall, service was good especially for a busy night and food was decent. I would definitely want to come back to try some drink specials and more desserts. =)

dtFloi7A9968D9pjaQeAXg.text: I am surprised at the 3 star reviews. I have always had great food and great service here. I love the pot roast, it is served topped with fried onions YUM! I think the prices fall in line with the quality and the portions. I'm not sure where the Luby comment came from unless he is 18 or even younger. The crowd whenever I have eaten there has been a wide variety but usually a high concentration in the 26 or so to 40 range. This little gem doesn't disappoint. Good eats and good prices.

1-L6hg8QOAYDh9iU8pH6ZA.text: I had lunch here the other day and it was really pretty good, that 16th / Bethany intersection is not lacking for good restaurants either!  I went with six other people and everybody really liked it.  Smooth decor, decent service, and competently prepared food with a SW flair.  Soup, sandwiches, salads, all were a hit!!  Their brunch is the stuff of legends although I have yet to partake.

s4F9mCSuPRmSyA5OKCIqsw.text: Okay, so I've not been here for any other meal than brunch, because I am absolutely in love with the corn griddle pancakes with chicken.  My boyfriend always gets this too, so I've never tried anything else.  But it's awesome, matched with a mimosa, guaranteed the rest of your Sunday will be wonderful.

L5rlu3JYvdnFBNjStM6xmA.text: Nice, neighborhood place...wouldn't suggest people go out of their way to check it out, but good if you are in the neighborhood.

NThrCWrwlB6MdyPwULxbYw.text: I went to the Phoenix City Grille with my parents last week after going to the Arizona Tourism Show at the Convention Center downtown. My parents just moved back to Scottsdale after living in Houston for 2 years, and on our way home we realized we were starving, so my mom remembered the PCG and suggested we try it again after at least 5 years not having been there. It's a little off the beaten path (although easily accessible from the 51), but I have to say that it was one of the best meals we'd had out in AGES!!!! I live downtown Chicago, where the culinary/dining scene is truly one of the best in the US, and the quality and presentation of the food here really impressed me. Just a fantastic place.  My mom and I decided to try a bunch of appetizers, and my dad had the pork tenderloin.  We had the fish tacos, the bacon-wrapped shrimp, the griddled corn cakes, and the crab cakes.  I cannot tell you how fantastic each and every one of these appetizers was!!! The fish tacos were the best we'd EVER had--and we're a major fish taco-eating family! Fresh grilled fish with a chipotle-lime aioli and pickled red onions--just fantastic. The bacon-wrapped shrimp were HUGE! I don't know where they get these shrimp, but they're incredible, and stuffed with cotija cheese. Yes, a little rich, but absolutely delicious.  The griddled corn cakes--incredible! They totally balance that sweet-salty thing that everyone loves, and the corn cakes were soft, fluffy, and surprisingly very light.  Then the crabcakes. We're originally from Maryland so we're VERY picky about our crabcakes--and we were shocked to discover they actually did them correctly!! Fresh, lump crabmeat (not shredded!) and very little filling, served with an incredible lemon aioli sauce and a little salad. Just amazing!  My dad had the pork tenderloin, and he's a bit of a picky eater and left not a single scrap on his plate! I love how the waiter asked him how he wanted it prepared (yes, you can have pork tenderloin done medium), and it was served with jalapeno preserves, these incredible mashed potatoes, and roasted root vegetables. My dad cleaned his entire plate and loved every bite.    On top of it all (yes, we were stuffed!), we decided to split a dessert--the bread pudding, which was absolutely DELICIOUS. Not overly sweet or rich, and nicely presented. Excellent coffee, too.  I was so pleasantly surprised by how great the Phoenix City Grille was that I just HAD to put a review on Yelp (and this is my first!).  Our server was excellent, and I don't have a bad thing to say about this place.  I wish it were in Chicago! We'll be back as soon as possible.  5 stars.

wUea7L-VgiH71mHx4IooWA.text: A good friend and I went here for an early dinner mid week. It's a cute place, and the bar area was nice. I think they are trying to be something that they are not. Everyone else seems to have really liked it here, but my first experience was just so-so. The green chili soup was really good, the tomato salad was decent too. The prices were ridiculous for what you get. I also expected to get better service for being there at 5:30 on a Wednesday. It wasn't terrible, but I won't be returning.

0hccRosmONT5P9AnCY53Xg.text: Sooo tasty! Dim lights, semi-formal. There's a bar on the left and the dining is to the right. Tables/booths are placed far enough away that you can get a nice intimate dining experience. I love the macadamia nut chicken dish. Wow!!! The service is excellent also. The parking lot is weird and it's in a strip mall, but it's a diamond in the rough :)

fpdUC6qSwlvga9Sj5q1ScQ.text: Great place for lunch meetings.  Just above average Bar food.

WohGlws9vs3EeYj2ogcg9g.text: Phoenix City Grill is tucked away in a very nondescript shopping center on the Southwest Corner of 16th and Bethany Home Road. Dont let this blur your expectations, as the restaurant delivers a great business lunch, a filling dinner, and it also has a great bar for after late nights. The cuisine is American with a definite Southwestern flair, and with a good selection of meats and fish as daily specials. For large groups, they even have a back room that can seat 45 people comfortably for a party or meeting. The servers are friendly, and the owner Sheldon will do anything to make your experience worthwhile.

s2qDfi4SxOvt2Zsy93VCzg.text: We were visiting Phoenix and needed somewhere to share an Easter dinner. Found the Phoenix City Grille on Yelp. It's high marks are spot on. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They maintain a family run atmosphere (working in a family biz  I appreciate that) and the food was perfect. Even some of our more picky eaters were excited about their meals. We had six very satisfied diners. It is always a good sign to leave a restaraunt feeling elevated by the experience. P.S. the corn cakes really are incredible!

fFRqiVv2JsglsW-Z-yeZhw.text: We used to live near PCG so we decided to go back...The place still looks great...warm, love the colors and the ambience, still.  Our server was adorable, friendly, and on top of everything; however, the food was not nearly as memorable as it was 3 years ago, before we moved away.  I ordered the Rose Lane chicken that I thought was moist, but simply did not think the broth that it was "swimming in" was a compliment to the chicken.  Am not sure what seasoning they used, but it was not very good.  We ordered a caesar salad and the dressing was so blah that we ordered some ranch and tried to boost the flavor.  My husband had a wonderful glass of Fess Parker Chard and it was wonderful.  He ordered just the shrimp wrapped in bacon and thought they had been deep fried, vs. sauteed and that they were a bit dry.   We both preferred their old menu rather than the updated version.  Some of the fish items that used to be on the menu are now gone, being replaced with newer versions with odd side dishes that the server explained could be changed for other options, which was nice.  I hope they will bring back some of the oldy but goodies of days gone by!

qNI7tKzASk4f1FM5fzN_9A.text: I hadn't been to PCG in years, and had actually forgotten it was there with all the good restaurants in this area. So when we didn't want to wait 45 min to get into Richardson's, we crossed the street and had dinner at Phoenix City Grill. We were seated right away. Service was good. I love the ambiance and decor of this place. Great for a date night, yet still casual dining. Wine list was good. I can't say much for the food because I always order the same thing, which is awesome - PCG chicken pasta. Good stuff. Can't wait to go back and hang out in the lounge for happy hour soon. Looks like fun.

uc0_TESA5s4oTPvt_hQPIg.text: Love this restaurant! It's our first time in but would definitely come again...our waitress was wonderful. She helped us to choose the bacon wrapped shrimp as our appetizer, the shrimp are huge and absolutely delicious. We also had the crispy eggplant bites very good too. All 4 of us enjoyed our entrees...portions were perfect which left us room for dessert! We shared the bread pudding, the chocolate torte and the buttermilk pie all three were delicious. A perfect night out in a perfect city!

Ojmfe1-Put54PdulY8hcEA.text: Good but not great local restaurant. I have been going off and on for a couple of years now. I have to say the food is always consitant but lacks serious flavor. I have noticed the service is sometimes spotty as well. I feel like their sister restaurant Sierra Bonita has much more appeal to me. I will continue to go as I have never had a bad experience, but just once I would love to have a mind blowing meal!

-EzH6rCf-Fmwur6pDQ91Qg.text: This is a great date spot. it is elegant but not to posh nor will the price leave to bad a taste in your mouth if things don't sizzle after dinner. The lighting is dim so it has a touch of romance to it. You can hear each other talk, small detail. I love good service and this is one place that I have always had great service. I have actually only had great everything here. The food is nothing super fancy or exotic but it is always good, if you order a steak med-rare that is the way it will come out. I enjoy all the apps, in fact I love going for happy hour and just having apps. The location is central and easy to get to, and it is always packed so you might have to wait so grab a drink for the bar and enjoy the scents flowing from the kitchen.

AL50atZPQI56K6cY1LcxqA.text: I wish I could remember the name of the pasta I had here, but I can't! And I can't find their website to look at their menu either.  All I can tell you is that it was delicious and I was the envy of all the diners at my table.  I could see everyone eyeing my pasta and wishing that they had got what I did.  AND it was pretty big, so I ended up taking half of it home with me. Nice!  For dessert, I had the pumpkin cheesecake, which was amazing.  Really, really good. Definitely give this place a try!

q_XNcUKVFoYg2Lyv9cU70A.text: We love this place.  It's close to home and never disappoints.  I can honestly say, that I've never eaten anything I don't like.  It's always a sure thing.

aJ9lrMLLhYHq7Ke6JaNvvQ.text: I have eaten here many times and have always had excellent food.  The  service is very good, and the ambiance nice.  It's a little pricey but worth it.  I usually try the daily special because so far I haven't been disappointed.  The food has a nice sw fare but isn't too heavy.  If you are  looking for a solid choice for dinner that will please  just about anyone, try Phoenix City Grill.

zyU7RU88_ty4BbfoMPIZGw.text: Yeah - I like those griddled corn cakes, too.  I didn't know so many other people had discovered them.   I've often ordered whatever was a special of the day and never been disappointed with that, either.  I'm sorry so much of the shopping center is empty, but it does make it easy finding parking.  The place is nice enough for business lunches, too.

FOp1FAllWV0Aox2WM57xsg.text: Next to Richardson's, PCG is my favorite American style resto/bar in this sector on the grid.   I refer to this as part of North Central Phoenix, though those sorts of definitions begin to get muddled if you look closely enough. The Phoenix City Grill is a wonderful date restaurant, with excellent service, a classy, upscale decor, great service, superb wine, and fair prices. That combination is hard to come by, in my experience, so I have always been a fan.   The cuisine is new style American, with some Italian and western european influence. I have had a salmon pasta dish there a number of times that I always am happy with, but more than anything I am drawn back by the great wines and desserts.   There are a couple of Chilean wines that I highly recommend, as well as any dessert that they offer.   If you haven't been and you are looking for a nice new spot to take someone, PCG is a great call.

_laoa53C5RGXEBsIhCua_A.text: Great food. Never really a long wait. A lot of old people though. The staff is just ok. If you ask for something say you don't want in a dish they get incredibly nervous even though you know they can do it every single time haha.

lGdjuyETRPadlMDXvSxNHw.text: Super lunch place if you're anywhere close, and for happy hour. Good beers on tap. Try the crispy eggplant sandwich. And always ask to hear the specials...worth it!!

3fzghrCAMvb57CzMIBHbnw.text: This place is by far my favorite place to eat. My first time going there my parents took me for my bday! Their eggplant bites and corn cakes are thee best appetizers. Their bread pudding is thee best sweet thing I've ever put in my mouth! Thumbs up to this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their bread pudding is by far thee best dessert I&#39;ve ever had
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best eggplant bites I&#39;ve had ever! I could live off these things

ePj57xQM_sbj3xRyjOZ_gQ.text: I love this place. Usually my wife and I sit in the bar area and we are taken care of by a fine cadre of barkeeps.  B School Boyos Austin and Connor are the bartenders we see the most.  They are friendly and know how to conjure up a classic cocktail. PSG has a solid southwestern menu, a passable happy hour, yummy fish specials and the versatility to be visited often.

zzPjChh91G3CVTJjCmg6IA.text: AWESOME! The food and waitstaff are fabulous. No matter if it is Brunch,lunch or dinner it is always creative and delicious. Waitstaff is friendly and efficient. We've been going there for 4 years and we think best place in the city.

G77APtMdUJ1ddGTeNqbLpw.text: Hubby and I love this place.  Good service, great food, OK prices (hence the 4 stars).  Have had the fondue appetizer twice here and it's awesome.  Get it on happy hour!  Dinner entree I had was a chicken dish with mashed potatoes - A-mazing.  I'm always a little hesitant to order chicken because it's often dried out, but this was moist and delicious.  Had a starter caesar salad which was "ok" - maybe had a little too much anchovy in the dressing for my liking?  Overall a terrific place, and we'll certainly be back.  Mondays they have happy hour 3pm to close!

MTGIAVcHryfAGjF1QGO2wQ.text: I ordered a half chicken and potatoes. I was surprised to have received a half of a gaming hen chicken. I was very good, but i was wanting more. Small portions.

PIA09hZE6R3M_2-FesXACw.text: Ambiance is nice but the food lacks taste and is overpriced.. I also found it interesting that the waitress couldn't remember our order to save her life. Came back on several occasions to ask what we ordered.

DHAYphVC1W7O5lcGcpDsPA.text: Happy hour is great.  Carne Asada tacos, green chili chicken enchiladas, yum.  Bread pudding desert is to die for.  Also liked the prickly pear iced tea.  Definitely worth the price.   David was a great waiter!

UGLFReR7VSStD62Rv4hu0w.text: Let me start out by saying that my ONLY critique and the ONLY reason I didn't give them five stars, is I made reservations on Open Table and because of a lot of people lingering in the restaurant, they put us in the bar.  But, I have to say that really turned out to be not a bad thing as our server was excellent, the food was excellent and the wine was smooth and wondeful.  I had their 16th St short rib stew (and kuddos that you have a small portion option) and it was scrumptious.  I practically licked the plate and you always know its a winner when I don't offer to have anyone taste my dish.  It had been a long time since we were there and I doubt if it will be a long time before we go back.

FhFyW85BBTILWdtFyPbPXA.text: For many years, PCG has been the favorite restaurant of my wife and myself.  We have gone for lunches, happy hours, dinner, or just stopped in for drinks or coffee and dessert. The ambience is elegant and inviting.  The food is wonderful to taste and artfully presented.  The service, either at table or at the bar, has never been less than superior. The prices are moderate - some of my friends have suggested prices are on the high side, but great food and drinks with terrific service is not cheap, and I have never had reason to complain. We regularly dine at a number of the restaurants that have opened in the North Central area in the past several years, and while each has unique and positive attributes, PCG has become our benchmark, against which all others are measured.  Well done, Phoenix City Grille!  We will be coming back.

ClYDQjXc2r9U833byYvYcw.text: Outstanding service! Everything was fresh and served absolutely superb. Over exceeds expectations. Staff is very welcoming and friendly. Loved it!

HPJ2D-4_95FSTo9_AIaUjw.text: Phx city grille is amazing !!!!! We go at least once a week great atmosphere and  food is great. A True gem to phx ....

p2PxFIMsPTPqkdgLj3p6QQ.text: We are in Phoenix somewhat often and we are always looking for great new restaurants to try here. There are many choices and we have had some wonderful meals here, so I suppose we shouldn't have been surprised to find the food fabulous and the service stellar, especially considering the great reviews here on yelp.  We found out afterward by talking to the owner on the way out that it was his wife who was our server. She was pleasant and gave us great service. All the staff, including the bartender, were friendly and efficient.   Every thing that we ordered was really good. I had the lamb chop special of the night with sun-choke potatoes. The potatoes were creamy and delicious. The grilled corn cakes were wonderful. I would love to go back the next time I am here. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

9yzFvrwHRO5AavDiyxgJSA.text: We had an amazing Valentine's Day dinner here this year. All the food was amazing. Warning!: The homemade margarita is more like a shot! Very delicious but very dangerous! ;)

8Mo3Z-5cRuOBh4yD1trlyw.text: I just happened to be in the area on an early Sunday eve and was looking for something fairly light and something different. I pulled up my Yelp app and this was one of the local places that pulled up. I saw "griddle corn cakes" and they looked just right. I ordered for a pick-up and my husband and I went in to wait the 5-10minutes for it to be ready.  The bartenders, host, and waitresses were all very friendly and attentive. We had a good conversation with one of the regulars at the bar and got the food. It looked so good, we just pulled into a parking spot and ate it right there.  The corn cakes were delicious. They had chicken and cheese, black beans and salsa. I don't usually write reviews every time I try new places, but I must give credit where credit is due. I will be back there again to try some of their other items. Can't wait.

QHNY9XNpjS3KeAMPapiFAA.text: Went because of good reviews here, but wasn't impressed. 1. My fried eggs on the green chile enchiladas were gooey.  Not mentioned on menu or by waitress, and I didn't realize this was a common style.  I know it's my preference, but runny eggs disgust me. 2. Waitress and hostess were a little rude to our party.  Subtle, but repeated. 3. No refill offer on soda during entire meal as it sat empty.  Everyone else enjoyed their food though, so while it wasn't a great experience I'm sure they generally serve good food and guests enjoy their meals.

h_Yq4tR24ySyYNCU1KRsCQ.text: My new favorite dish at PCG (actually anywhere) is the new Surf N Turf Pasta entree. It is freakin' amazing! Cooked to order medallions of beef (I believe its filet) and HUGE prawns over a bed of fettuccine noodles. Seasoned with diced green chilies, corn, and a bit of cheese, it's"s a bit spicy, but over all just so dang tasty.   I also have recently tried their Dreamy Draw Chili and it is a winner. Made of pinto beans, it's"s different from your traditional red sauce chili.   I honestly have not had a bad dish at PCG. Kim is the best server they have, but maybe we're biased because we know her. If you still have not tried PCG, make it a point to do so soon. I hear their parking lot remodel is completed. :)

Nd4SgZKInLb_oSsvBTxz4A.text: My boyfriend had driven by several times and since we live in the neighborhood we decided on a whim to pop in and are so glad we did! Read some other reviews that recommended it as a good date spot and I agree. Dim lighting and great service were good starters. My bf got the slider to start then we got skewers to share. They were awesome.  For entrees my bf got the tenderloin and I got the surf and turf pasta. My bf happens to be a foodie who has traveled the world so when he likes a place it is outstanding- and he did! I loved my shrimps as big as a baby's foot and the beef was so tender. It was melt in your mouth good.  To finish I had the bread pudding which we were told were made from croissants that they make onsite fresh everyday. It had a lush sauce that went with it but it wasn't too heavy. Perfect end to a great meal. So glad this is a local place that we can add to out favorites.  As far as cost- you can get out of there for $40 for 2 and have a good meal or you can get the higher end dishes which will run you a bit more. Great place and we will be back soon!

QRPONTrKLlDIPfgPHCbywQ.text: This is our favorite local restaurant. We've been coming here for dinners (and a Mother's Day brunch) since mid-2009, when I found it on Yelp. It's in a nondescript shopping center, and if not for the constant traffic jam outside, you probably wouldn't even notice it.  I particularly like the lighting inside the restaurant; it's very relaxed and seems classier than it should be, given the location.  The burger is great, but the chicken sandwich is easily the best I've had. I also enjoy the PCG Pasta. And they have a lot of great beers on tap.  We live in Chandler now, but I'll make the drive to PCG any time I get an opportunity!

IdiCTbXcZ_Ugu630s2wsuA.text: Just celebrated my birthday there as well with 22 others. We were all very happy with the service and food quality. Brittnee helped organize the private room and it was perfect. I would highly recommend the Phoenix City Grille for larger parties in a quiet, separate room.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My friend loved these ribs.

RKhrAuRVfbgfBjUUWQpJeA.text: My wife organized an event at this facility in their private room. Brittnee was not only very patient with the endless questions and our need to accommodate about 2 dozen guests, but the night of the event she was incredibly attentive. The food was excellent and drinks kept coming.  Thank you, Brittnee! We will be back!

iKQdBY1HlvSYWgR_BfGUCA.text: This an upscale, independent, neighborhood restaurant that takes reservations. They offer gluten free options, happy hour and brunch. So why don't I frequent this place?  I just don't know... I've never left here thinking the food or service was amazing but I've never thought it was bad either. This is a place I agree to go to at someone else's suggestion, but I never suggest it on my own. So try it, I guess, or go a few more miles and spend a few more dollars at Hillstone where you are guaranteed a great dining experience.

v2IQsLjZ8z4WmJKpjdkThw.text: Wait staff was friendly & accommodating in every way from initial reservation consultation to the final bill. Food was right on the money -- I specifically appreciated the flavors of the chicken tortilla soup and the bread pudding with whiskey lime & caramel! Will definitely be back in the future. Special thanks to the restaurant for catering to the demands of a large party! Brittnee & Erin were outstanding and went above and beyond to ensure a fine dining experience. Thank you!!

HfEzO9SVFoM9ziPZsXjQKQ.text: Pretty good food along with the drinks. Liked the ambience and looked like a decent place for happy hour.

-xzECbkn0FHCOhPSBsUn0w.text: Stopped in at the Phoenix City Grille yesterday for a late lunch/brunch. I ordered the chicken enchiladas with green chiles and a fried egg. Delicious but could have been hotter. My partner had the steak bahn mi that was tasty. Our two friends each had the cheddar burger and they loved it. We were happy with our meals and the service was good.

xhNA9Xg2yj9v6c3xgo2QTA.text: I've driven by PCG for years and finally tried it out with my wife. The food was great and the service was even better. Sonja was energetic and knowledge about the food. I will definitely be return and recommending

hv-5FI4IjLNqwWJvb6lX9A.text: We needed a bite to eat and came here mid-Saturday afternoon.  Based on Yelp reviews, I was expecting better.     There were only one or two other parties in the restaurant and it took the waitress a rather long time to get to us.  I understand there was only waitress on at the time but the hostess and bartender were chatting at the bar while we waited for someone to pay attention to us.    My chicken was overcooked.  It was flavorful but tough. My wasabi mashed potatoes were tasty although there was no hint of wasabi whatsoever.    I had a mandarin mule that was okay but not great.    All in all, not a great experience.

EJXBNu-EoEDo975uMsCoGw.text: This restaurant, although tucked in a strip mall is definitely worth visiting. I ordered a steak at the bar with vegetables and a baked potato. I ordered my steak medium rare- which is often hard to achieve these days, but it came out with a soft red center. Perfect! I can't remember feat wine I paired it with but the bartender was more than happy to make suggestions. It was bustling when I went it. Probably a little later than happy hour on. Tuesday, but packed. It had its regulars, so if you're planning on going in a large group make a reservation. Definitely will try this place again, next time cocktails and a different entree!

_p1zRPAue6xHG109NPzBIg.text: We enjoyed a delightful meal last evening.  This restaurant always has a warm, pleasant atmosphere with music that is complimentary but not overpowering.   Our party of three had 2  wonderful servings of baby back ribs done to perfection and one order of superb cedar plank salmon.  All food and wine presented was by an excellent waiter.  Thank you for a most enjoyable evening. TG

89ThZG0Bwj9GWxgRqqE8Rw.text: You will not find one thing on this menu that is not crazy flavorful. Great ambiance, locally sourced food, never rushed service. Check out the corn cakes, eggplant bites, and cedar plank salmon.

SX-eDZWO8ajC6X5jcwpgQA.text: PCG has the best staff ever, if you're stoppin in for the first time and you like shrimp and bacon... the bacon-wrapped shrimp is a must try!  Since the first time I've been there, I've come back and left full and satisfied!

g7JAOpmIYF-kDneeq0UTqQ.text: The Phoenix City Grill was described by friends as their local "Cheers" bar.   Well, I have to tell you something. Although a Norm *does* frequent this joint I'd rather come here ANY day over the tv version. This place is swank! (Sorry friends. Your description needs tweaking.)  I met my friends at the bar area. I parked out back and walked in via the kitchen area. I did NOT, however, realize I would be walking through a full on kitchen. NOPE. I closed the door in confusion. Double-checked the sign outside that said, "Enter Here" and proceeded. A very understanding employee provided me "directions" to the bar.   The bar zig zags around to the hostess stand. This is nice so everyone is not lined up like soldiers and conversations flows. There are standing height tables in the bar area as well. The restaurant section has booths (noted on the way to the bathroom) and copious seating. There is also a private room for events behind the elegant wall of wine.  Using the company's weekly email we scored a free appetizer. The "Red chile pork tacos" come two to a plate and are divine. Grilled pork tenderloin w/chipotle aioli & pineapple fennel salsa. YUM.  Having had a late lunch I could not possibly justify a decadent dinner. But I desperately wanted to after the tacos. Alas, no. Instead, I enjoyed a mouthwatering cup of the daily soup (Friday is the chicken tortilla).   The group shared something called "Crispy Eggplant Bites".   Goodness! Red pepper relish, goat cheese, arugula and a sherry vinaigrette are layered over a crispy heavenly crunchy shell. What this heaven is made of I should have asked. But no, I was too busy inhaling to inquire. (Four to a plate. Big enough for a group to share. IMO. However, I could see a tipsy person opting not to. This stuff is seriously good!)  I also fork sampled my neighbor's plate "The Original Griddled Corn Cakes". This is a neat mixture of sweet, spice and well, cheese. And I like cheese!  I'd say I'd come back and eat these things again. But NO. I want to try different things *next* time. Brunch looks a-m-a-z-i-n-g. So does lunch. And all the great entrees I had to pass on. (Aww man!)  With a full belly I understood the "Cheers" reference. You come here repeatedly.   If you sit in the bar area look for Jose, JP & David. All three bartenders seamlessly moved between guests without missing a beat. Our glasses were never empty.  Even though we were waited on by all three of them service was transparent.  Oh! And keep an eye out for the owner, Sheldon. He's making the rounds and greeting guests too!  This place is super popular for good reason. If you're coming for a special occasion or with a larger group (which they can readily accommodate) I'd recommend a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Main dining area!
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A thing of beauty!
Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House red!

iTYLbTxrMIdItAPaGzHlTA.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. It was my first time here and won't be the last. We ordered the braised beef short ribs and they were phenomenal! I would highly recommend this dish! Overall it was a great experience.

qUI5mCc3ETaTOh2TQBuL9A.text: This is such a jewel in the crown of the 16th and Bethany intersection! Happy hour is maybe the best in town. Frank, one of the many wonderful and knowledgeable bartenders at PCG, will make one of the best drinks you will ever have! And, if you like spice, have the best ribs in town.

-FYVNLSD4tItvujR8KBu-Q.text: Loved the tasty food here & cocktails! Came here for happy hour that soon went into dinner. Their happy hour specials are great! We kept ordering their amazing French 75 cocktails non-stop. The bartenders make it to perfection there, so I highly recommend it! I had the grilled asparagus with lemon aioli that was yummy! My fiance ordered the carne asada tacos, which he said were fantastic. For dinner I had the beet salad that was good. Staff was friendly & food was good. Don't forget to try the French 75...it has become my favorite cocktail thanks to this lovely place & brilliant bartenders :)

g0r3GM_xgL5w-7I6tWlD5g.text: I'm not sure if it's the generic sounding name or if it's just the nature of your typical american grill type restaurants not sounding exciting to me anymore, but I seem to always forget how good this place actually is.  The Restaurant itself is located in a strip mall but the inside is very well decorated and service is always friendly.  I don't really have that much to say here - it's your typical American Grill with some Southwest flair but unlike most of those places it is actually very good! And it's local to boot!

RXIV7n5ud22GwxDv2M-Ypw.text: I practically wake up some nights dreaming about the eggplant sandwich. My server suggested it at my first visit, and it was so incredible it's the only thing I will ever get b/c it really is THAT good!

TmI61Om6CU-JeZ0jBoGY-g.text: Incredible experience! We met my daughter and her fiancee for dinner, who happens to be a manager of a local restaurant himself. We we're all impressed with the creativity of the food and the service was perfect! We will be going back, it may be our favorite restaurant now!

5F3cbSk4a0zL443HKAIpvw.text: Locally owned and the food is fantastic and also locally sourced.  The cedar plank salmon is one of their best sellers and is delicious and the beef short rib just melts in your mouth.  The other really good dish is an appetizer that you can share and that is the The Original Griddled Corn Cakes.  Layered corn cakes with black beans, chicken and cheese, it is awesome.  Give this place a try and you wont be disappointed.

DOhhImAqpUAuLgDlFZ2Cwg.text: Great place. Been a patron of PCG for over 8 years. Great service, atmosphere and food.

XKo_m3DnTJmKHlhM6H4rsw.text: This place is fantastic! We had dinner here on a Tuesday night and were promptly seated and welcomed by our waitress. She was darling and so attentive. We ordered eggplant bites, beet salad, and burgers, and everything we ordered was delicious. One of our burger orders came out wrong and the waitress apologized, changed the order, and comped it as well (perfect service). The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the prices are reasonable for such great food. Highly recommend.

eqTexiMOP_db2nnMH8zt_g.text: This is by far my go to place to dine and take guests.  I absolutely love what they do...and they do it all extremely well.  I've always wanted to own a fine neighborhood restaurant and grill and PCG is the model I'd use for the place!

L4lUnJMtdU4b5SYDMZ6kIw.text: Always a good classic comfortable place with really good food. Excellent ceasar salad, great short rib, salmon was beautiful!

HesvPzR7oDX6ZSeMq4YAsA.text: Gotta love the Mac and Cheese, the Ceaser Salad and my favorite is the hummus plate.  My family members and I enjoy this Grille with their consistentcy.

yuAPWq_X0EvDsWULFXHIPw.text: The food and scotch selection here is amazing.  Street tacos and bacon wrapped shrimp 4Life!!

yYZi8UoSyS4ni9CTaQ8Txw.text: Food was very good, had the chicken. Loved the mashed potatoes! Had gluten free items clearly marked on menu.

faWAbB1muxPPmOii5Znasg.text: We stopped in about noon on a Saturday. I had the Philly Cheese Steak sandwich with Wagu beef, peppers, onions, and jalapeno mayo on a fresh roll. My side was horseradish infused mashed potatoes. The beef was tender and very tasty. Good bread. Awesome sandwich! The potatoes were melt in your mouth, and went perfectly with that sandwich. By the way, the coffee was strong and good too. Melissa had the corn cakes, black beans and house potatoes. The corn cakes had bacon and cheese on the inside. I tried everything she had, and I would order it myself anytime. Everything was cooked perfectly. The place was not crowded, actually pretty empty. We may have just had good timing. Service was great, friendly and informative. Food came out fast. Lots of things on the menu that we would like to try sometime. We will definitely return, and recommend you try it.

icQ8_gX5yUYqjiuqGl94fQ.text: This is one the best gems in Central Phoenix. Great atmosphere, food, and friendly staff. I came here for a friends birthday brunch with a 10 plus group. We sat in the bar area and Austen our server was great. We always had our drinks fast and was very attentive. (FYI the mimosa is amazing with fresh squeezed orange juice). My friend got the Bloody Mary and said it was good with fresh asparagus and olives. I ordered the Egg Benedict vegetarian style. It came with crispy eggplant. So delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix City Grille - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait and hubby ate half before the pic ;)

JFQugPj45YZrd-aktr6onw.text: I highly recommend for an event or dinner out - great food and service AND they always fit in my budget. I've been holding events here for years, Brittnee is a joy and so easy to work with when planning an event - everything runs smoothly. I've never heard an event attendee complain about a single item on the menu nor from receiving bad service,

MV8BvaWLjfvPejr3kmhsPg.text: I recently hosted a work function in one of their private dining rooms. Brittney helped coordinate the menu and was also our server for the evening. Fantatsic service all the way around. The food was out of this world. Great taste, quality ingredients and unique flavors.  I will definitely be back!

gha5kMa9tnlNMf_eMV2dhw.text: This is a classic "go to" place in central Phx that never disappoints.  During the peak season you best have a reservation but during the summer you can pretty much get right in!  Last night I went with a group of friends for a birthday celebration and was eagerly anticipating another great meal!  We sat in the bar first as we waited for all of our group to arrive.  We enjoyed cocktails before moving to our large table.  Our waiter was very attentive and told us about the nights specials.  We were disappointed to hear the meatloaf and pork chops had been removed from the menu but there were plenty of options to replace them.  Of our party of 8, I think 4 of us ordered the Cedar Plank Salmon!  One person ordered a pasta, one ordered the fish special of the night and I think two ordered steak.  We all devoured our meals and everyone commented on how delicious....especially the moist salmon!    For dessert we ordered two of the Chocolate Lava cakes and one Buttermilk Pie with Caramel sauce.  Again....devoured and delicious!  Prices are reasonable and the portions are ample.  If you haven't tried Phx City Grille you need to!  There are plenty of new options in the central Phx corridor and more keep popping up but lets keep supporting the old local favorites too!

4WzX-uHV6XYceviTAT-ABg.text: Went here for dinner after getting back from Vegas on our week long vacation and decided to stay at a couple more resorts before heading home.  We heard about this place and it was a great choice.  Ordered the Grilled Beef tenderloin and horseradish mashed potatoes, the steak was amazing and I had to sub the potatoes for garlic mashed, I dont like horse radish but the waitress was super nice, I wish I could remember her name. The service and amiance was romantic for a Wednesday night.  I ate the entire thing. I think my hubby had the short ribs, it was a blurr after the full tummies.  Going back soon!

OOzSSKMjX-aSeCv-3rWHGw.text: I enjoyed everything about my dining experience.  The food was an excellent representation of traditional fare, with just enough of an eclectic twist to make it unique while familiarly enjoyable.  I ate every bite, of all three courses despite my stomaches protest, my taste buds couldn't resist.  The server was pleasant and attentive, and the atmosphere was quaint yet quite enjoyable.  I would highly recommend this place.

2fJRcmVujEOoHZk9LvpeTg.text: Great food, ambiance and service! I had the baby backs which were spicy and good! The cornbread was perfect as was the coleslaw. My wife had the chicken club, fantastic!  I would highly recommend this place!

JGAKyuF8SI87YK0eijKNxg.text: Phoenix City Grille was fantastic. It's polished casual from the decor and the price point but the staff seems to be a veteran staff who has a firm commitment of being the local place where all the neighbors can enjoy a fantastic meal. We dined at the bar for happy hour and instructed the bartender to send us his favorites. We were impressed by all of his choices. The Green Chile Queso Dip was delicious and came out piping hot, the Sweet Corn Griddle Stack was surprisingly delicious. The pool of black beans toned down the sweetness of the cakes and the chicken and cheese stuffed inside made for a tasty bite. The only thing we didn't totally enjoy was the beet salad. For a beet salad we expected it to be beet heavy and it seemed to be more of an afterthought. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and we will be back.

oXHUwPgvCaUQLlkzICFFvA.text: Was visiting my brother in Phoenix and wanted a decent place to eat without having to drive out too far.  This place was right down the street so we tried it.  Place is in a strip mall ( I have an aversion to strip mall establishments), but overlooked that.  Walked in on a Tuesday evening and the place had a decent amount of patrons, so that was a good sign.  We started off with the bacon wrapped shrimp (yummy), the eggplant which I could have replaced with something else.  I ordered the pasta which was very good, the sauce wasn't too heavy which I liked.  My brother had the ribs which fell off the bone and came with fries and the portion was quite big.  My bf had the sea scallops which were cooked to perfection on a bed of mashed potatoes.  His dish was delicious but toward the end did start to feel a bit rich and heavy.  I also had a margarita on the rocks which they were generous with.  All in all, good experience and probably would go back if i were back in the area.
